amen maiesties humble faithfull obedient subiect thomas bentley lampas virginitatis ecce tibi lucet princeps clarissima lampas tenebris gressus dirigat illa tuos siquaeris librum cur lampada virginis istum inscribam causa dico fuisse duas vna est quod talem praefert ecclesia lucem expectans sponsum virgo pudica suum altera quod manibus virgo reginea librum sumit cuiverae lampadis instar erit dum domino litat sacris indicit honorem nuncupat christo vota secunda suo anna sibi lucem sibi debora praetulit istam que suis princeps elizabetha mali sic didicit lenire suas sic fallere curas praesentem que sui poscere regis opem quem non plenum sacris placant altaria donis non oblatorum corpus caesaboum ille deus deus ille humili libamine vocum irae deponit iusta flagellum suae illecebras carnis almightie protection diuine fauour continuall blessing finallie commend betake labour selfe deere welbeloued reader beseeching loue loue vnfainedlie speake worke woorse doo christianlie sake alone loued v deerelie loue v endured maner reproch slander might patientlie euen effusion pretious bloud often sundrie time trulie well feruent praier sweat otherwise crosse eternall glorie therefore inestimable benefit bloudie praiers dririe death bitter passion euermore rendred giuen writer reader angel men creature heauen earth deepe possible praise perpetuall glorie hart thinke hand worke toong speake amen owne owne euer thomas bentley facies militantis ecclesiae iam prope sexagies redijt centesimus annus quum laeso aeternum seruans sub pectore vulnus incensis animis gerit implacabile bellum cum serpentino mulieris semine semen nam pater omnipotens nec iam pater improbus ex quo seduxit serpens primo errore parentes nullus amor natis dixit nec foedera sunto exoriare aliquis pura de virgine vindex cuius dextra caput serpentis conterat cui iratus serpens leniter calcanea tundat nunc olim stirpem pono genus omne futurum exercendum odijs vtrin que que impero tolli infestas aquila aquilis contraria pilis pila ala ali signa minantia signis haec deus ex illo struere male nectere serpens arte dolos coepit belli que opponere molem nulla quies aetas quae tempore fluxit ab illo militia est hostis factum iam grande periclis ingenium longo creuit solertia bello effrendet que draco ruber immortalibus iris crudelis reparat que nouas praelia vires audet nobis sumptis confligere telis nam peccatorum bene quae numerantur ab illo vel numero miseras anima vel pondere terret tunc apte mortem peccati ostendere stipem tunc stygias turmas totum que acheronta ciere promptus hijs hominem petit exitialibus armis non par lex huius non ius aequabile pugnae no sumus terris est coelestibus hostis non pede congreditur pe densus que viro vir sed micat tenebris spiritualibus armis vtitur nocet non vult nocuisse videri improbus infligit vulnus ne que vulneris author extat sic pugnat sic est metuendus abaddon adde alios hostes quos intus habemus extra hinc caro no blandis odijs affabilis hostis enecat leni peccati imbuta veneno strangulat inclusas anima conficit intus extra alias scelerum face diras que cohortes et coniuratum cernas obsistere mundum quacun que aspicimus timor vndique vndique terror infernae que ruunt acies praedam que requirunt christicolas quem da finem rex magne laborum no tua progeny coeli quibus annuis arcem perdimur ac coeli longe disiungimur oris haec est illa fides potis est quae vincere mundum inferni que fore sic no sceptra reponis ollis subridens christus qui cuncta serenat oscula libauit natis dein talia fatus nata deo prole ex viui semine verbi multum dilecta mihi dilecta parenti moestane per tantos semper iactabere fluctus nec quae sit tua spes quae sit victoria noris tu sathanam tu tela time ignita gehennae esto tuos quondam potuit superare parentes nec dum animo exciderint irae saeuo que dolores et veteres verset fraudes ac pectora tentet atque omne secum phlegetonta praelia ducat idcircone tuo poteris diffidere christo nec venit mentem quam crux ferat alma salutem ille vides leo terribilis quique omnia saeuus circuit immanis rugit praedamque futuram faucibus expectat siccis quem pessima ventris exigit impransum rabies exutus inermis cruce confossus iacet en victor leo iudae inferni fregit porta contudit omnes peccati vires mortem morte peremit haecspolia aeterna lauros ex hoste reporto ecce deum summum medijs est cernere terris coelis hominem tibi sese aeterna reseruant gaudia cum superis homini bene conuenit actum est vicisti pepigit cum terra foedera coelum iam cherubinorum vagina includitur ensis atque iterum tibi se tradit paradisus habendum namque ego quem gremio tellus absorpsit iniquo vincula perrupi mortis coelumque petiui et cupis hijs mecum pariter considere regnis regnum quod teneo vestrum est hic meta laborum iudaque gensque mihi nullo discrimine agetur pugnat adhuc sathanas confert agmina pugnet iusti materiem praebet tibi pugna triumphi per varios casus per multa pericula rerum tenditur coelum sedes vbi fata quietas ostendunt illic fa laeta pace potiri durato temet rebus seruato secundis sic placitum dum te pieta excocta periclis splendeat viua formetur imagine christus tempus erit quum paucis labentibus annis cernes densis venientem nubibus quum regnabis mecum victo dominaberis hosti tu modo posce deum veniam sacrisque litatis arma assume dei causa que innecte morandi bona simplicitas animi tibi baltheus esto quo stes contra ictus omnes circundata lumbos indue iustitiae thoracem pectora muni tum pro calceolis coelestis nuncia pacis aptato pedibus certis super omnia viuae sume manu scutum fidei galeamque salutis spem capiti imponas laterique accingere ferrum spirituale pares hostem stringe rebellem quicquid aduersum verbo est interfice verbo sic vbi iam mundi decursa volubilis aetas post exantlatae diuersa pericula pugnae non arescentis folijs redimita corona foelix coelestem patriam hierosolyma cernes dixerat extemplo moestos attollere vultus coepit afflictis laetari ecclesia rebus infuso que oleo manibus sua lumen portans praesto lansque suum patiens laeta maritum vota deo supplex animo solennia fundit l rob marbeck ad lectorem avscultat nostris diuina potentia votis et prece non pretio flectitur ira dei perlege scripturas sanctum volumina patrum assiduis precibus no vigilare iubent si male te morbus prostratis viribus vrat si te paupertas inuidiosa premat per steriles saltus per dura inhospita saxa passibus ambiguis si vel inermis ea si mare te iacter si tempestatibus actus et coelum terras mox ruitura putes si te circunstet vel mille pericula mortis inuoca nil dubitans numen saluus eris ergo si precibus vi tanta putetur inesse praeponi precibus nil mihi crede potest hic labor hic liber est tibi quem bentleius offert nil aliud resonans quam pietate preces et pius est author pius conatus vtrun que cur perames causam candide lector habes argumentum libri vin tibi quid portent haec scire volumina septem occurrunt animo lumen sparsa tuo nulla quidem frustra est praelata virgine lampas ostendit varias illa que illa preces prima docet myriam quas olim debora fudit quas domino iudith fudit aanna preces altera reginis quas nostratibus vsquam legimus medijs incaluisse mali hic katherina suas mulieribus aemula sanctis hic cernit princeps elizabetha suas tertia habet psalmos quos pro solamine nostrae reginae docti composuere viri hic modo de nostri loquitur moderamine regni excipit hic votum principis ore deus quarta alias fuse complectitur omnibus aptas personis rebus temporibus que preces quinta precum formas narrat quas foemina quaeuis seu virgo fuerit siue marita legat sexta locos recitat sacris e fontibus haustos possit vt officium foemina scire suum continet historias illarum septima quarum vel bona vita fuit vel mala vita fuit hinc saram propone tibi castam que rebeccam et subeat menti sanctum maria tuae illinc ante oculos infamis iezabel adsit occurrat que tibi labe notata thamar sic exempla pares illustria turpia vites historiae fructus maximus ille sacrae interea bentlaee tuo de lumine lumen qui facis accensum fratribus esse tuis hic aeterna pij cernis monumenta captaines also drowned red sea deepe water haue couered sunke bottome stone thy right hand lord become glorious power thy right hand lord hath dashed enimie thy great glorie thou hast ouerthrowne rose vp thee thou sentest foorth thy wrath consumed stubble blast thy nostril water gathered together fluds stood still heape deep water congealed together hart depth sea enimie said pursue ouertake diuide spoile lust shall satisfied vpon drawe sword mine hand shall destroie thou didst blowe thy winde sea couered sanke led mightie water like vnto thee lord among god mightie men world like thee glorious holinesse fearefull praise shewing woonders thou stretchest thy right hand earth swalowed thou thy mercie hast caried people thou hast redeemed deliuered thou wilt bring thy strength vnto thine holie habitation land canaan mount zion people nation shall heare afraid sorowe shall come vpon inhabitant palestina duke edomites shall amazed trembling shall come vpon great mightiest men moabites inhabitant canaan shall waxe faint harted feare dread shall fall vpon bicause greatnes thine arme power shall still stone till thy people passe lord till people passe thou hast gotten purchased thou shalt bring plant mountaine thine inheritance mount zion place lord thou hast made prepared dwell euen sanctuarie lord thine hand shall establish lord shall reigne euer euer pharao horsebacke went pitie deliuer rose vp mother israel chose new god war enimie gate shield speare seene among fortie thousand israel hart resist enimies hart set gouernours israel loueth willing among people praise yee lord speake yee gouernours ride faire asse sor moiles yee dwell middin danger enimies walke way noise archer among drawer water ceased shall rehearse righteousnesse lord righteousnesse vnfenced townes israel people lord go downe gate without feare enimie debora vp arise sing song arise barak lead thy captiuitie kept thy people bondage captiuitie captiue thou sonne abinoam remaine haue dominion ouer mightie people lord hath giuen mee dominion ouer strong ephraun roote iosua first arose fought amalek thee iosua beniamin saule shall fight thy people amalek machir came ruler zebulun handle penne writer euen learned helpe fight prince issachar debora whole tribe issachar also barak sent foote vallie diuisions ruben great thought hart abodest thou among sheepfold heare bleatings flock diuisions ruben came ouer iordan helpe brother necessitie great thought hart much maruelling gilead abode beyond iordan yet came helpe brother therefore thou ruben canst haue excuse doth dan remaine ship asher continued sea shore taried desolate decaied place people zebulun nepthalie haue ieoparded liues vnto death hie place field king came fought fought king chanaan taanach water megiddo wan monie lost fought heauen euen starres course fought sisera god power people holpen ouer come enimies riuer kishon swept away beesome doth filth house ancient riuer riuer kishon soule thou hast marched valiantly horse hoofes broken praunsing oft beating together mightie men curse ye citie meros ye fought said angel lord curse inhabitant thereof bicause came helpe lord helpe lord mightie iael wife heber kenite shall blessed aboue woman blessed shall aboue woman dwelling tent asked water gaue milke brought foorth butter lordlie dish put hir hand naile hir right hand workman hammer hammer smote sisera smote head wounded persed temple bowed downe hir feete fell downe lay still hir feete bowed himselfe downe fell sunk downe lay dead destroied mother sisera looked windowe cried lattise chariot long comming tarie wheeles chariot hir wise lady answered hir yea answered comforted hir selfe hir owne word surely haue gotten found diuide spoile euerie man hath damsell two sisera hath praie diuers coloured garment euen praie raiment died sundrie colour made needle worke raiment diuers colour needle worke side meete chiefe distributing spoiles let thine enimies perish lord loue shall sunne hee riseth might growe dailie god fauour land rest fortie yeeres praier blessing naomy hir two daughter lawe ruth orpah ruth lord shew fauour deale kindlie good daughter yee haue dealt dead husband two sonnes barrennesse let arrogancie come mouth lord god knowledge purpose come passe enterprise established bowe mightie men broken weake haue girded themselues strength full hired foorth bread sell labour necessarie foode hungrie hired cease haue neede barren hath borne seuen euen many shee many child waren feeble lord killeth maketh aliue bringeth downe graue raiseth vp againe lord maketh poore maketh rich bringeth lowe exalteth vp high raiseth vp poore dust according owne lifteth vp begger dunghill set among prince make inherit seate glorie pillers earth lord hath set world vpon therefore may dispose thing pleasure prefer honour keepe feete saint shall neither walke fall euill wicked shall keepe silence darkenesse owne might shall man strong lord aduersaries shall destoried heauen shall thunder vpon ye lord shall iudge end world shall giue power vnto king iesus exalt horne christ annointed song woman israel praise dauids victorie ouer goliah samuel saule hath slaine thousand dauid ten thousand praier wish abigael king dauid enimies samuel oh lord haue committed iniquitie praie thee let thine handmaid speake vnto thee heare thou word thine handmaid let lord praie thee regard wicked man nabal name nabal name follie thine handmaid sawe yoong men lord whome thou sentest therefore lord lord liueth thy soule liueth lord say hath withholden thee comming shed blood thine hand saue thee reuenge thee thine enimies pray god thine enimies intend doo lord euill may nabal praie thee forget trespasse thine handmaid c song sion familiar talke mysticall communication diuine dialogue speciall loue betwene spirituall bridegrome iesus christ bride faithful soule sanctified chaste holie spouse church commonlie called song song ballat ballats made king salomon cantic church faithfull soule speaketh christ thou wouldest kisse kiss thy mouth euen thy peace passeth vnderstanding thy loue christ better pleasant vnto wine bicause good pleasant sauour thy pretious balmes ointment euen thy great benefit taste feele thee thy name christ sweet smelling ointment powred shed foorth thy mercie set foorth published preaching thy gospell therefore uirgins euen pure hart conuersation doo loue thee drawe thou sweete christ vnto thee wee run thee otherwise confesse come thee except drawne thee king hath brought priuie chamber reuealed vnto secret ioies knowne world therefore glad reioice thee yea wee thinke thy loue wine righteous loue thee aboue thing blacke confesse spot sinne persecution trouble ye daughter ierusalem yet comelie faire welfauoured faith blood christ whose fauour haue confidence trust fruites tent kedarens arabian hanging curtens salomon within set pretious stone iewels maruell therfore bicause blacke regard consider outward apperance sunne euen corruption nature sinne affliction hath looked shined vpon yea mother child euen mine owne brother haue fauoured angrie hauing euill mee made keeper vineyard mine owne vineyard haue kept ala hath beene mine owne negligence therefore feeling fault imperfection flie vnto thee christ spirituall husband onlie succour beseeching thee saieng tell thou soule loueth thou feedest sheepe shew saie thou liest makest rest noon day like hir turneth aside goeth wrong flock thy companion whome thou hast called dignitie pastor thy church yet like apostataes onelie set foorth owne false dreames tradition steed thy true doctrine also become domesticall enimies persecute church christ speaketh church faithfull soule thou fairest among woman thou knowe thy selfe art ignorant way go thy way foorth footstep flock sheepe euen doctrine apostle feede thy goates kid tent shepheards learne true pastor spirituall doctor haue compared thee loue vnto troupe horse chariot pharao bicause thy spirituall beautie excellencie worldlie treasure compared vnto thee thy cheekes thy neck beautifull turtle behanged spangle chaines goodly iewels neckband also imbrodered gold stud button siluer make thee church king sitteth table repast hee shall smell nardus spikenard reioice admitted companie husband christ yea welbeloued bundle mirrh vnto mee shall lie betwixt brest deere vnto welbeloued saie cluster camphire vnto vineyard engedi wherfore long followe christ erre true faith saluation christ faire art thou loue oh faire art thou thine eies like dooues eies behold acceptable art thou vnto commend thy beautie church oh faire art thou also beloued welfauoured pleasant art thou bed euen hart faithfull thou christ dwellest thy spirit greene bedecked flower beames seelings house cedar tree crosse ioints cipresse rose field lillie vallies christ yea like lillie among thornes loue among daughter church preferred aboue thing yea also among mine enimies church like apple tree among tree forest welbeloued among sonnes men testifie loue great desire towards delight sit rest vnder shadowe bicause fruite word sweet vnto mouth strength faileth bringeth wine seller spreadeth banner loue ouer mee desired comforted saieng set mee cup flagon wine comfort apple sicke loue lo haue felt left hand vnder head right hand doth imbrace mee christ charge daughter ierusalem yee ruler haue doo church solemne oth roe hind field yee wake vp loue touch hir trouble hir quietnesse vntill please content hir selfe church thinke heare ye voice welbeloued spouse christ behold hath taken nature vpon commeth leaping vpon mountaines skipping ouer little hils helpe church beloued like roe yoong hart behold hauing diuinitie hid vnder cloke flesh standeth behind wall looking foorth windowes shewing himselfe thorough grate haue full knowledge life welbeloued spake said vnto christ loue arise stand vp faire one come thy waie go thine owne behold winter sinne error infidelitie past driuen backe put awaie comming flesh compared springtime thing flourish raine changed gone awaie flower good work come vp appere field time bird singing come voice turtle dooue holie ghost heard land fig tree bringeth foorth hir fig vine beare blossom haue good smell stand vp come loue arise saie beautifull one come awaie dooue thou art caues rock hole wall secret place staires thou saie art ashamed thy sinnes come shew thy selfe vnto let see thy countenance heare thy voice sweete thy voice faire comelie thy face take v fox yea little fox destroy vine suppresse heretikes enimies church while yoong begin shew malice destroie vine preaching false doctrine vine beare blossom haue small grape church welbeloued mine hee feedeth among lillie vntill daie breake till shadowes gone returne praie thee come againe beloued christ like roe yoong hart vpon wild mountaines bether euer readie helpe defend danger bed night trouble sought soule loueth yea diligentlie sought found carnall reason scripture neither incontinentlie heard bicause must continue praier till feele comfort though feele first therefore thought rise get vp go citie street hie way open place seeke praier continuallie soule loueth desire ioined inseparably christ husband sought carnall reason found scripture seeking vnto others also hoped haue comfort succor last watchman went citie found mee said sawe ye soule loueth little past found preaching word soule loueth haue gotten hold vpon let go vntill haue brought mother house euen chamber hir conceiued bare christ charge ye daughter jerusalem ye ruler magistrate haue doo church solemne oth roe hind field ye wake vp loue touch hir trouble state quietnesse peace thereof vntill please content hir selfe church speaking hir deliuerance wildernesse beautie salomon temple saith commeth vp wildernes like pillers vapour smoke perfumed sweet smell mirrh incense maner spice sweet powder apothecarie merchant thinke like comming child israel led wildernesse followed christ fortie yeeres behold bedsted temple salomon made round stand threescore strong men euen valiant mightie men israel handle sword expert war euerie one hath sword vpon thigh watching keeping defending temple word god bicause feare night king salomon made himselfe palace chariot tree wood lebanon hee made pillers therof siluer pauement couering therof gold hanging thereof purple whose mids ground paued pleasantlie loue daughter ierusalem come foorth yee daughter zion euen yee number faithfull behold king salomon euen christ become man crowned loue god glorious crowne diuinitie wherewith mother crowned daie mariage daie gladnesse hart christ faire art thou loue faire art thou choose praise commend thee haue great delight thou hast dooues eies euen simple sincere faith besides lieth hid within thy hearie lock euen fruit true faith like wooll flocke goates shorne vpon mount gilead great respect haue multitude faithfull one manie number thy teeth faith faithfull made sonnes god equallie like flocke sheepe good order bignesse went vp washing place euerie one beareth two twin one vnfruitfull barren among thy lip like rose coloured riband thy word louelie thy talke comlie thy cheek temple like peece pomgranate within thy hearie lock thy necke preacher like tower dauid builded costlie stone lieng side defence thousand shield hang therein yea weapon targats giant strong men fixed therein thy two breast old testament new wherin knowledge zeale two pretious iewels like two twin yoong roe feede among rose might go mountaine mirrh hill frankincense till daie breake till shadowes past awaie thou art faire loue spot blemish thee sight come mee lebanon spouse come lebanon looke top amanah top shenir hermon den lion mountaines leopard euen corner world call thee church faithfull vnto sister cal thee church respect haue taken flesh man vpon spouse thou hast wounded bewitched hart loue sister spouse thou hast wounded hart one thy eies chaine thy necke yea loue gift thee haue therewith made beautifull rich faire thy brest sister spouse faire thy loue thy breast loue much better pleasant vnto wine sauour thine ointment passeth spice thy lip spouse bicause thy confession thankesgiuing preaching gospell drop honie combe bring foorth much consolation comfort yea milke honie vnder thy tongue sweet smell sauour thy garment like smell lebanon sister spouse garden well locked inclosed spring shut vp fountaine sealed vp fruit planted thee like verie paradise orchard pomegranate sweete fruit camphire nardus spikenard saffron calamus cinamon sweet smelling tree incense mirrh aloe best spice church fountaine garden well liuing water spring lebanon confesse glorie beautie commeth thee christ art true fountaine grace goodnesse church thy spouse arise north wind come thou south wind come blowe garden spice smell thereof may flowe carried euerie side yea let welbeloued come garden eate sweet plesant fruit growe therein desire haue thee christ beloued spouse come comfort powre grace thy holie spirit quarter vpon christ come garden euen vnto kingdome church prepare banket mine elect bestowe vpon singular benefit sister spouse haue gathered mirrh spice haue eaten honie honie combe haue drunke wine milke eate ye also friend drink ye make merrie welbeloued church sleepe troubled care worldlie thing mine hart waketh heare voice welbeloued knocketh saieng christ open sister loue dooue derling mine vndefiled mine head full dew lock heare full night drop hauing long patience towards sinner church haue put cote confesse nakednesse hauing selfe nothing shall put againe haue washed feete made cleane shall defile selfe againe yea therefore seeing thee made cleane promise vnto thee neuer defile pollute selfe sinne againe welbeloued put hand hole doore hart bowel affectioned moued towards rose vp open beloued hand dropped mirrh mirrh ran downe finger vpon hand barre locke opened vnto welbeloued departed gone waie past hart gone speake sought would faine haue beene annointed christ could find bicause thought annoint good work sought saie could find called cried vpon answered mee left time end might stir vp greater desire continuall praier wicked watchman false teacher went citie found smote wounded conscience tradition yea watchman kept walles tooke awaie vaile kerchife mee charge therefore ye daughter ierusalem ye godlie watchman zion whence lawe saluation commeth ye find welbeloued tell sicke loue ye direct vnto daughter ierusalem faithfull christian church saie thou fairest among woman maner man thy welbeloued aboue louers welbeloued thy loue doo louers thou dost straightlie charge v church welbeloued describe perfect beautie comlinesse vnto white ruddie coloured goodliest chiefest person among ten thousand head fine gold lock curled blacke rauen eies like dooues eies water brooke looke though washed milke remaine fuller vessel set like pearles gold cheekes like garden bed wherin apothecary plant maner sweete spice flower thing lip like lillie drop downe pure sweet smelling mirrh hand like gold ring set chrysolite pretious stone tharsis bellie like white iuorie deckt couered ouer saphyres leg pillers marble set vpon socket fine gold face countenance lebanus excellent beautie cedar tree mouth word thereof sweet altogither louelie wholie delectable euen one loue yee daughter ierusalem maner man welbeloued spouse christ daughter ierusalem faithfull church saie thou fairest among woman whither thy welbeloued christ gone whither thy welbeloued turned aside also may seek thee hearing excellencie beautie inflamed greatlie desire knowe find also church welbeloued gone downe garden conuersant earth among men church directed scripture vnto sweet smelling bed spice loue come may refresh himselfe feede garden gather lillie assure selfe loue christ welbeloueds welbeloued mine feedeth among lillie christ thou art beautifull loue place strong faire citie tirzah thou art comlie faire ierusalem fearfull terrible armie men banner turne awaie thine eies mee haue set fire ouercome mee exceeding loue towards thee church yea must need praise thy spirituall comlie beautie also thy member thy hearie lock like flocke goat go downe shorne vpon mountaine gilead thy teeth like flocke shorne sheepe go vp washing place euerie one beareth twin one barren vnfruitfull among thy cheekes temple like peece pomgranate within thy lock heare threescore queenes fourescore concubine wiues damsel without number faithfull manie number diuers order degree men therein gift grace doo giue vnto church infinit dooue one alone mine vndefiled dearling onlie beloued daughter hir mother deere vnto hir bare hir diuers particular church dispersed make one catholike church daughter sawe hir said blessed ye euen queenes concubins wiues praised hir looketh foorth morning faire moone pure sunne terrible fearfull armie men banner though beginning church small yet hath growne vp great multitude went downe vnto nut garden looked vpon church subiect affliction fruit bringeth see grew brook vallie vine budded vineyard pomgranats flourished went downe saie synagogue see fruit came lawe prophet knew nothing found thing rebellion therin soule set chariot noble people vnder tribute ran swift noble people chariot call repentance saieng come againe turne againe shulamite thou perfect one turne againe people ierusalem turne againe looke vpon thee shall ye see shulamite ierusalem shalem signifieth peace like men war singing companie pleasant beautifull thy going shooes thou prince daughter ioints thy thigh like faire iewell wrought hand cunning workemaister thy nauell like round goblet cup neuer without drinke wanteth liquor euer replenished rich knowledge god word heauenlie desire thy bellie wombe heape wheate set lillie euen full spirituall treasure thy two breast old testament new came god like two twin yoong roe equall authoritie church thy necke preacher like tower iuorie ought pure godlie thine eies also like water pooles nesbon gate bathrabbin euen thy magistrate must well instructed god word thy nose iudges good euill like tower lebanon looketh toward damascus thine head standeth vpon thee like carmel skarlet heare thine head like purple king tied gallerie rafter dwelleth among manie water conduit delighteth come neere thee thy companie faire louelie art thou loue pleasant art thou dearling pleasure thy stature like palme tree pressed persecuted groweth increaseth thy breast like cluster grape said climbe vp palme tree take hold hir high boughes thy breast also shall like cluster vine smell thy nostril like sauour apple roofe thy mouth like best wine meet best bloud causeth lip ancient speake church welbeloueds desire turne towards come welbeloued let v go forth field take lodging village remaine christ morning get vp earelie go see vineyard see vine sproong forth grape growne pomegranate flourish shot call professe word account fruit doo bring foorth church giue thee loue breast euen grace faithfull church mandrake haue giuen smell gate sweet thing new old haue kept thee beloued church father old testament might find thee without see incarnation christ kisse thee whome loue brother suckt mother breast despise thee mee leade thee bring thee mother house thou christ mightest teach might giue thee drinke spiced wine sweet sap pomgranats left hand shall vnder head right hand shall imbrace gratious fauour shall preserue desperation aduersitie presumption prosperitie christ charge ye daughter ierusalem ye magistrate elder rule church ye stir vp contention war therein wake loue tumult trouble vntill please thus commeth vp wildernesse leaning vpon hir welbeloued waked raised thee vp among apple tree thy mother conceiued thee thy mother saie bare thee brought thee world church set seale vpon thine hart signet vpon thine arme thy spouse desire ioined perpetuall loue thee christ seale holie ghost loue strong death ielousie cruell graue coales thereof fierie coales verie vehement flame lord manie water able quench loue neither may streames fluds drowne yea man would giue substance house loue count nothing would greatlie contemne haue little sister namelie church gentils yoong hath breast wanteth old new testament shall doo sister shall spoken sure firme wall build vpon hir siluer palace doore keepe fasten hir boords cedar tree church sure fast meete husband dwell apostle preach called inwardlie god saluation yea wall breast tower doo promise fidelitie constancie vnto spouse christ one hath found fauor peace sight salomon lord christ hath vineyard baalhamon vineyardlet vnto kepers euerie one fruit therof giue thousand peeces siluer vineyard mine sight thee christ spirituall salomon apperteine thousand peeces siluer two thousand keepe fruit thereof euen greatest profit life euerlasting obteined grace god merit thou dwellest garden thy church thy companion faithfull one hearken vnto thy voice let heare also companion may hearken vnto welbeloued christ thou flie awaie depart v thy faithfull one yet beseech thee like vnto roe yong hart vpon sweet smelling mountaines spice make haste praie chae come againe helpe v trouble amen foure lamentation daughter zion church wherin weeping sighing howling heauie wofull hart sorowfullie bewaileth hir miserable estate plagued god forsaken hir spouse christ sinnes vnfaithfulnesse rebellion lament first lamentation ala doth citie jerusalem remaine solitarie desolate sometime full people become like widowe brought vnder tribute great among nation ruled land prouinces princesse weepeth sore continuallie night teares run downe hir cheekes shee taketh rest among hir louers hath none comfort hir yea hir next friend trangresse hir haue dealt vnfaithfullie hir become hir enimies iuda caried away captiue bicause hir crueltie affliction great bondage seruitude oppression seruants poore dwelleth among heathen findeth rest hir persecutours tooke hir strait place shee could escape way street zion mourne lament bicause man commeth anie mirth ioie woont solemne feast hir gate desolate hir priest sigh make lamentation hir virgin discomfited hir maides carefull hir selfe great heauinesse hir aduersaries chiefe ruler ouer hir hir enimies prosper lord hath chastened afflicted hir hir great wickednesse hir child gone captiuitie enimie multitude hir transgression daughter zion hir beautie gone departed hir prince become like hart finde pasture euen men pined awaie sorowe haue courage driuen awaie gone without strength enimie pursuer haue power ierusalem remembred time hir miserie affliction bare estate rebellion hir toie pleasure hath time past seeing hir people brought downe vnder power enimie man helpe hir enimies stand looking hir laugh mocke hir sabboth day hir religion seruing god scorne ierusalem hath greeuouslie sinned therefore come decaie derision hir honour despise hir haue seene hir filthinesse yea sigheth turneth backward ashamed hir selfe hir filthinesse hir skirt manifest yet ashamed hir sinne remembred hir last end therefore hir downefall woonderfull man comfort hir lord behold mine affliction consider trouble mine enimie hath vpper hand hath proudlie magnified himselfe enimie hath put hand pretious thing yea euen hir eies came heathen entred hir sanctuarie whome thou neuerthelesse didst command forbid come within thy church congregation hir people sigh seeke bread heauinesse looke pretious pleasant thing euerie man hath giueth meate saue life refresh soule consider lord see vile become haue ye regard pitie yee passe waie behold see anie sorowe like vnto mine wherewith lord hath afflicted troubled day fierce fearefull wrath learnc beware mine example aboue hath euen god sent downe fire bone preuaileth burneth cruellie hath spred laid net feete turned backe throwne wide open hath made desolate dailie heauines must euer mourning yoke transgression bound fast god hand wrapped wreathen come vp vpon necke meanes shaken remitted onlie speciall grace mercie hath made strength faile lord hath deliuered hand neither able rise vp quit selfe haue bondage lord hath troden vnder foote destroied valiant mightie men middes hath proclauned appointed time called assemblie slaughter destroie best yoong men lord hath troden downe virgin daughter iuda like grape winepresse therefore weepe mine eies euen mine eies gush water comforter quicken refresh soule far child driuen awaie desolate enimie hath gotten vpper hand preuailed zion casteth hir hand none comfort hir lord hath laid enimies iacob round ierusalem menstruous woman hir pollution separate hir husband become abhomination middest lord righteous haue rebelled commandements prouoked countenance anger heare praie take heede ye people behold sorowe consider heauinesse virgin maiden yong men led awaie prisoner gone captiuitie called louers deceiued priest counsellers perished died hunger citie euen while sought meate saue liues refresh soules behold lord consider troubled bowel swell wombe disquieted hart turneth within full heauinesse rebelled stubbornelie sword spoileth abroade death doth home heare mourning none comfort mine enimies haue heard trouble glad thereof thou hast done thou wilt bring forth daie time thou hast pronounced calledst also shall like vnto let wickednesse come thee thou vnto thou hast done vnto transgression trespass sorowe verie great sighes manie mine hart heauie second lamentation zion ala hath lord darkned daughter zion wrath brought hir prosperitie aduersitie hath cast beautie honour israel downe heauen vnto earth giuen hir sore fall remembring owne footestoole temple ierusalem daie wrath angrie lord hath cast destroied habitation iacob without anie fauour strong place holdes daughter iuda hath broken wrath throwne downe ground spared hir kingdome prince thereof hath prophaned polluted wrath fierce indignation hath broken horne power strength israel hath drawne backe right hand succour enimie yea flame fire kindled iacob hath consumed deuoured vp round hath bent bowe like enimie right hand stretched vp fastned aduersarie euerie thing pleasant eie see hath slaine hath powred wrath like fire tabernacle daughter zion lord become enimie hath deuoured israel consumed palace yea strong hold hath destroied filled greatlie increased daughter iuda much sorrowe heauinesse lamentation mourning hath destroied tabernacle garden solemne meeting congregation hath put downe yea lord hath brought passe high solemne feast sabboths cleane forgotten zion hath despised heauie displeasure indignation wrath king priest lord hath forsaken owne altar hath abhorred owne sanctuarie hath giuen walles hir palace tower hand enimies haue made noise blasphemous shouting criengs house lord daie solemnitie feasting people accustomed praie lord hath determined breake downe walles daughter zion spread line hath withdrawne hand destroieng therefore maketh insensible thing euen rampart turret walles take part sorowe mourne lament fell downe destroied together hir gate sunke downe ground hir bar broken smitten sunder hir king prince caried awaie gentile haue lawe neither haue hir prophet anie vision lord senatours elder daughter zion sit vpon ground keepe silence haue cast vp dust ash vpon head girded themselues sackcloth virgin maides ierusalem hang downe head ground mine eies faile weeping abundance teares bowel swell liuer powred vpon earth great hurt destruction daughter people bicause child babe suckling faint sowne streetes citie haue said mother bread drinke sowned fell downe wounded streetes citie gaue vp ghost died mother bosome thing shall take witnesse thee thing shal liken thee daughter ierusalem thy calamitie euident neede proofe whome shall compare thee thou virgin daughter zion comfort thee withall breach thy hart like breach maine sea may heale thee thy false prophet haue looked vaine foolish thing thee haue discouered thine iniquitie shewed thee thy wickednesse turne awaie thine affliction keepe thee captiuitie flatter thee thy sinnes haue seene looked false prophesies cause banishment destruction passe waie clap hand thee hissing wagging head vpon daughter ierusalem saie citie men call faire perfection beautie ioie whole earth al thine enimies gape vpon thee open mouth hisse thee grinde teeth saieng let v deuoure certainlie daie time looked come haue found seene lord hath fulfilled thing purposed doo performed word deuised determined old time long ago hath throwne downe destroied spared hath caused thine aduersarie reioice triumph ouer thee hath set vp horne power thine enimie hart cried vnto lord thou wall citie daughter zion let thy teares run downe like riuer daie night take thee rest neither let apple thine eie cease leaue weeping arise stand vp crie night beginning watch powre thy hart like water face lord lift vp thine hand towards liues yong child faint die hunger corner street behold lord consider whome thou hast done thus shall ye woman eate fruit euen child span long shal priest prophet slaine sanctuarie lord yong old lie ground streetes virgin yong men slaine fallen sword thou hast slaine put death daie thy wrathfull indignation yea euen thou hast killed spared terrours euen mine enimies feared round hast thou called feastdaie daie lord wrath none escaped neither anie left behinde haue nourished brought vp hath mine enimie destroied consumed third lamentation zion gold prince become dimme fine gold changed stone sanctuarie priest scattered corner euerie streete noble men zion alwaie honour cloathed pretious gold esteemed become like earthen vessel worke potter hand small estimation without anie honour dragon though cruell yet pitie drawe breast giue sucke nourish yong one daughter people become cruell woman forsake child like estriches wildernes forsake egge bird tongs sucking child cleaue roofe mouth verie thirst yong child aske bread man giueth woont fare delicatelie perish street afore brought vp purple scarlet make much doong iniquitie daughter people beecome greater wickednesse zodome suddenlie destroied taken hand anie camp pitched hir hir nazarites absteiners purer snowe whiter milke colour bodie fresh red corall beautie like polished saphyr greatly god fauour face verie blacke cole much none knowe streetes skinne cleaueth bone withered become like drie stocke greatest abhomination vnto slaine sword happier killed die hunger fade pine awaie striken lacke fruit field foode woman nature pitifull haue sodden owne child hand might meate miserable destruction daughter people lord hath performed heauie wrath hath powred furiousnesse wrathfull displeasure hath kindled fire zion hath consumed foundation thereof neither king earth inhabitors world would haue beleeued enimie aduersarie haue entred come gate ierusalem neuerthelesse contrarie men expectation come passe sinnes hir prophet iniquity hir priest haue shed bloud iust innocent midst hir blind men went stumbling street stained polluted themselues bloud heathen would touch garment cried vnto depart flee ye polluted awaie get hence touch priest vncleane remoued therfore fled awaie wandered yea haue said among heathen shall dwell anger wrath countenance lord hath scattered shall neuer looke vpon regard themselues neither regarded reuerenced face priest compassion pitie elder wherefore eies failed while yet looked vaine helpe man waiting haue looked aegyptians nation people could doo v good saue v hunt step lay sharpe wait v go safe street end neere hand day fulfilled end come persecutor swifter eagle aire pursued followed vpon v ouer mountaines laid wait v wildernesse verie breath nostrels euen iosias king annointed lord himselfe whome stood hope god fauour whome depended state life taken net slaine whome said shadowe shall preserued aliue among heathen thou daughter edom dwellest land huz go glad reioice destruction fall yet thou sure thou shalt escape cup god wrath shall passe come vnto thee also thou shalt dronken discouer thy nakednesse vomit vp thine owne shame good comfort therefore thou daughter zion thy sinnes fullie punished thy punishment accomplished seuentie yeres thy sorowes shal haue end carie thee awaie captiuitie thy wickednesse daughter edom shall visit discouer thy sin wicked shall tormented euer fourth lamentation complaint zion rod wrath haue experience miserie droue foorth led yea darkenesse light surelie turned turneth hand dailie flesh skinne hath made waxe old bone hath brused broken hath builded closed gall trauell hath set darke place dead euer hath hedged get hath laid heauie linkes chaines vpon also though crie call pitiouslie yet heareth praier hath stopped vp way hewen squared stone made path crooked laieth waite like beare lion hole secret place hath stopped vp way broken peeces hath laid waste made desolate hath bent bowe made marke shoote arrowe arrowes quiuer saie hath shot entred euen reines laughed scorne derision people make song ballet vpon daie long hath filled bitternesse made dronken woormewood great anguish sorowe hath made loose sens hath smitten teeth peeces stone rolled dust thus soule farre peace forgat prosperitie good thing said strength mine hope perished lord remember yet miserie trouble woormewood gall yea remembring soule doth still remember humbled within consider thing hart therefore get hope againe namelie lord mercy vtterlie consumed wickednesse truelie pitifull compassion faile new mercy shall lord shew vpon thee earlie daie springing euerie morning lord great thy faithfulnesse feele thy benefit continuallie lord portion saith soule therefore hope good lord vnto put trust soule seeketh hun good man silence patience doth trust waite health saluation lord good man take beare yoke vppon youth vp sitteth alone murmureth patient holdeth still keepeth silence hath taken borne lord yoke vpon laieth face vpon earth humbleth himselfe waiting patience may happen anie hope succour offreth cheeke smiter content reproches lord forsake euer though send affliction punish yet haue compassion according multitude mercy receiueth grace againe doth plague willinglie delighteth afflict child men doth necessitie amendment treade prisoner earth vnder feete ouerthrowe right man face high condemne man cause lord hath pleasure thing saith commeth passe lord commandeth without prouidence nothing done mouth high proceedeth euill good prosperitie aduersitie wherefore mourneth liuing man god afflicteth let mourne sorowfull owne sinnes suffereth let v search trie looke well vpon owne way remember selues turne againe lord let v without hypocrisie lift vp hart hand vnto god heauens saie haue sinned rebelled therefore hast thou spared thou hast couered v thy wrath persecuted v thou hast slaine without anie fauour thou hast hid thy selfe cloud praiers passe thou hast made v offscowring reffuse mids people enimies haue opened mouth v gape vpon v feare snare come vpon v yea desolation destruction whole riuers water gush mine eies destruction daughter people mine eie droppeth without staie ceaseth rest till lord looke downe heauen consider mine eies breake mine hart ouercome weeping bicause daughter people citie mine enimies hunted chased sore like bird yea without cause haue shut vp life dungeon cast stone vpon water flowed ouer mine head thought destroied called vpon thy name lord deepe pit lowe dungeon thou hast heard voice stop thine eare sighings crieng thou drewest neere vnto daie called vpon thee hast said feare lord thou hast maintained cause soule hast redeemed life danger lord thou hast seene wrong take thou cause vpon thee iudge thou hast seene vengeance deuises mee thou hast hard reprochfull despitefull word lord yea imagination lip also rise deuises whispering take daie long behold also sitting downe rising vp song reward lord according work hand giue sorrowe hart obstinate hart euen thy curse persecute lord thine indignation root vtterlie destroie vnder heauen fift lamentation praier zion call remembrance lord come vpon v consider behold confusion reproch inheritance turned stranger house alien vnderlings without father mother widowes haue drunken water monie wood haue sale sold vnto v neck vnder persecution wearie haue rest aforetime yeelded selues aegyptians haue submitted selues assyrian onlie might satisfied haue bread inough father gone haue sinned must beare wickednesse seruants haue rule v man deliuereth v hand must get liuing perill liues bicause drought wildernesse skin made blacke like ouen bicause trouble famine verie sore hunger rauish defile wiues zion maiden citie iudea prince hanged vp enimies hand haue honoured old sage men face haue taken yoong men slaues grind boy fainted vnder burden wood able abide elder haue ceased gate lawes forme commonwealth yoong men song ioie hart gone danse melodious meeting turned mourning garland crowne head fallen wo vnto v ala euer sinned therfore hart full heauinesse thing eies dimme weeping bicause hill mountaine zion destroied desolate insomuch fox runne vpon thou lord remainest euer thy seate throne generation generation world without end therefore thy couenant mercy neuer faile wherefore dost thou forget v euer forsake v long time turne thou v vnto thee lord shall turned renew day old time thou hast vtterlie banished reiected v thou art exceedinglie angrie displeased v praier thankesgiuing sarra tobit wife hir virginitie fasting weeping space three day three night made deliuered shame reproch wherewith hir father maid vpbraided hir tobit blessed art thou lord god thine holie glorious name blessed honourable euer let thy work praise thee euer god father thou art wroth shewest mercie time trouble thou forgiuest sinnes call vpon thee unto thee lord turne face vnto thee lift vp mine eies saie beseech thee lord loose bond rebuke else take vtterlie awaie earth may heare anie reproch thou knowest lord minc innocencie neuer desire vnto man haue kept soule cleane vncleanlie lust thou knowest lord say pure sinne man haue neuer polluted name name father land captiuitie haue kept companie passe time sport neither haue made selfe partaker walke light behauiour onelie daughter father neither hath anie man child heire neither anie neere kinsman child borne may keepe selfe wife husband haue consented take pleasure thy feare seuen husband dead one another liue endure great reproch counted murtherer husband peraduenture either haue beene vnwoorthie else vnmeete please thee die desire thou happilie hast kept another husband command looke pitie doo heare reproch thy counsell power man euerie one serueth thee sure life trieng shall crowned trouble god doubt shall deliuer life chastening shall haue leaue come vnto thy mercie thou hast pleasure damnation storme thou makest weather faire still weeping heauinesse thou giuest great ioie thy name god israel praised euer amen time hir praiers heard maiestie great god praier iudith made fasting teares deliuerance hir people bethulians hand holophernes assyrian host besieged citie iudith lord god father simeon gauest sword defence enimies take vengeance stranger vsed violence vncleannesse opened wombe maid dinah defiled hir rauished virgine discouered thigh shame polluted wombe hir reproch confusion thou hadst commanded yet sichemites meane thing thou gauest prince slaughter deceiued washed bed bloud hast striken seruants gouernors gouernors vpon throne thou gauest wiues praie daughter captiues spoiles bootie vnto thy child seruants israelite thou louedst mooued thy zeale abhorred pollution bloud called vpon thee aid god lord god heare also widowe helpe mee beseech thee thou hast wrought thing afore thing shall thou considerest thing present thing come thing thou dost purpose present saie behold heere looke thou hast taken hand deuised came euer passe thy way readie prepared thy iudgements put thine euerlasting foreknowledge looke vpon army assyrian like thy pleasure sometime looke vpon host aegyptians weaponed persecuted thy seruants put trust chariot horseman multitude men war thou lookedst vpon host casting thicke darknes came deepe water ouerwhelmed euen lord behold let go assyrian multiplied power haue exalted themselues horse horseman glory strength footman trust shield speare bowe knowe thou art lord god breakest battels destroiest war beginning lord thy name apperteineth vnto thee called lord lift vp thine arme like euer beginning breake thou strength thy power cause force fall thy wrath haue purposed yea make vaunt boast vnhalowe defile thy sanctuarie pollute tabernacle thy glorious name resteth waste spoile cast downe sword weapon horn thine altar behold pride bring passe lord blasphemie enimie holophernes may cut downe owne sword send thy wrath vpon head giue mine hand widowe strength haue conceiued may taken snare eies thou maiest smite lip loue smite saie deceit lip seruant prince prince seruant giue stedfast mind may despise strength may destroie shall bring thy name euerlasting remembrance thou abate strength ouerthrowe hand woman thy power lord standeth multitude men thy might strong men neither hast thou anie pleasure strength horse neither beginning anie proud person pleased thee praier humble meeke hath thy pleasure beene euermore thou saie lord art helpe humble little one defender weake protector forsaken sauiour without hope surelie surelie thou art god father god inheritance israel lord heauen earth creator water king lord creature heare thou praiers heare saie poore woman calling vpon thee putting trust thy mercie remember thy couenant lord minister word mouth stablish deuise hart thy house may continue still holinesse yea grant word saie craft wound stroke enterprise cruel thing thy couenant thine holie house top zion house possession thy child shew euidentlie among thy people tribe heathen may knowe thou art god power strength none defendeth people israel thou iudith hir praier shee made secretlie mentallie hir hart stroke head proud holophernes iudith lord god power behold present haue respect vnto work hand houre exaltation ierusalem thou maiest set vp thy citie like thou hast promised strengthen lord god israel grant may performe thing hope may done thee haue deuised time helpe thine inheritance execute mine enterprise destruction enimies risen v strengthen therefore daie lord god israel strengthen saie lord god euen houre iudith hir song praise thankesgiuing togither people made deliuerance hand assyrian destruction holophernes iudith begin vnto god timbrel sing vnto lord cimbals tune vnto psalme sing new song thankesgiuing vnto exalt praise ioifull call vpon name lord destroieth war breaketh battels euen lord name god hath pitched tent campe mids people deliuered hand persecutor enimies assur came mountaines north multitude strength came thousand armie multitude people stopped water brooke horse couered vallies purposed haue burnt vp border land said would kill yoong men sword dash suckling child ground lead awaie child virgin praie spoile captiuitie almightie lord hindered deliuered hand woman hath brought naught confusion mightie holophernes fall destroied yoong men sonnes titan slue neither haue great giant inuaded set themselues iudith daughter merari hir faire beautie comlie countenance hath discomfited brought naught put laid awaie garment hir widowhood put apparell gladnesse exaltation reioicing oppressed israel annointed hir face ointment bound vp hir heare coife tooke new stole linnen garment beguile hir slipper rauished eies hir beautie captiuated tooke mind prisoner sword faulchin smote head persian astonished hir boldnesse medes troubled hir hardinesse mine afflicted reioiced feeble one appeared drie thirst showted ioie persian medes feared lift vp voice howled turned backe child maides sonnes daughter haue pierced wounded fled awaie like fugitiue child perished battell verie feare lord god sing vnto lord song thankesgiuing new song praise sing vnto god lord lord thou art great glorious god maruellous mightie inuincible power man may ouercome let thy creature serue thee thou spakest word made thou sentest thy spirit created none resist withstand thy voice mountaines mooue leape vp foundation water stonie rock melt thy presence like waxe yet thou art mercifull feare thee sacrifice little sweet sauour fat little thy burnt offering feare thee lord shall great thee thing time wo people nation rise vp generation kindred almightie lord take vengeance himselfe daie iudgement hee visit sending fire woormes flesh shall burne feele weepe euermore praier queene hester made deliuerance hir selfe hir people bloudie hand haman conspired death hester lord thou onlie art king helpe desolate woman haue helper thee danger miserie destruction hard hand youth vp haue heard kindred father thou lord tookest israel among people father predecessor foreelders shuld thy perpetuall inheritance looke thou didst promise thou hast performed made good vnto lord haue sinned thee therefore hast thou giuen v hand enimies bicause worshipped god lord thou art righteous neuerthelesse satisfieth bitter heauie captiuitie oppressed among haue stroken hand idol abolish take awaie thing thou thy mouth hast ordeined appointed destroie thine inheritance shut stop vp mouthes praise thee quench glorie thy temple worship thine house altar open mouthes heathen may praise power vertue god idol magnifie fleshlie king euer lord giue thy scepter vnto nothing least laugh v scorne miserie fall turne deuise vpon themselues punish wicked haman meane make example hath begun v think vpon v lord shew thy selfe vnto v time distresse trouble strengthen mee thou king god lord power giue eloquent pleasant speech mouth lion king ashuerus husband turne hart hate enimies destroie hamam meane consent vnto deliuer v thy hand helpe thine handmaid solitarie haue defence helper onlie thee lord thou knowest thing lord thou wotest hate glorie worship vnrighteous abhor bed vncircumcised heathen thou knowest necessitie hate token preeminence worship dignitie beare vpon mine head time must shew selfe seene abhor vncleane menstruous cloth weare quiet alone selfe thou knowest also thine handmaid haue eaten haman table haue pleasure delight king feast drunke wine drinke offering thine handmaid haue ioie since daie brought hither vntill daie thee lord god abraham thou mightie god aboue heare therfore voice haue none hope deliuer v hand wicked deliuer feare susanna hir praier made time condemned false witness die adulterie susanna euerlasting god thou searcher secret knowest thing come passe thou knowest haue borne false witnesse behold must die whereas neuer anie thing men haue maliciouslie inuented praier church made hir affliction captiuitie psalme vnto thee lift vp mine eies thou dwellest heauens behold euen eies seruants looke vnto hand maisters eies maiden vnto hand hir maistresse euen eies waite vpon lord god vntill hee haue mercie vpon v haue mercie vpon v lord haue mercie vpon v vtterlie despised soule filled scornefull reproofe wealthie despitefulnesse proud song blessed virgine marie mother sauiour christ made time felt hir selfe conceiued sauiour iesus hir wombe luke soule magnifieth lord spirit reioiceth god sauiour hath looked poore degree lowlinesse handmaiden seruant behold hencefoorth shall generation call blessed bicause mightie hath done great thing holie name mercie feare generation generation hath shewed strength arme hath scattered proud imagination hart hath put downe mightie seates exalted lowe degree hath filled hungrie good thing sent awaie rich emptie hath vpholden helped seruant israel mindfull mercie euen spake father abraham seede euer woman canaan praier vnto christ hir sicke daughter matthew haue mercie mee lord thou sonne dauid daughter grieuouslie vexed diuell lord helpe vouchsafe beseech thee whelpes may eate childrens crums fall maisters table praier late fiue foolish virgin matthew lord lord open v god onlie glorie amen
