composed first french vertuous ladie margaret queene navarre aptlie exactlie fruitfullie translated gratious souereigne ladie queene elizabeth tender maidenlie yeeres hir youth virginitie great benefit god church comfort godlie p imprinted london henrie denham dwelling pater noster rowe signe starre cum priuilegio regiae maiestatis certaine godlie sentence psalme written queenes maiestie latine french italian latine stultus dixit corde suo non est deus illi corrupti sunt abhominabiles sua impietate nullus est qui aliquid boni facit french le fol dit en son coeur il ny point de dieu il sont corrompus abhominables en leur impiete ilny nul qui face aucun bien italian lo stolto disse nel suo cuore egli non vi e dio essi son corrotti abomineuoli ne la lor impieta non vi e nessuno che faccia alcun bene godlie meditation inward loue christian soule towards christ lord first chapter soules slauerie sinne redemption christ passion hell full trauel paine mischiefe torment pit cursednesse doth spring desperation hel profound sufficient punish ye tenth part sinnes number manie infinit swarme shadoweth darkened sens account neither yet well see farre entred among haue power obteine true knowledge deepe danger perfectlie feele also roote sinne graffed selfe find none effect either branch leafe fruit bringeth foorth looke better branch therof shadoweth mine eies mouth doth fall would speake bitter fruit cursed sinne spirit stirred harken noise hir leaues stoppeth mine eares filleth nostril smell hir flower behold therefore paine soule slaue prisoner without light comfort lieth crieng weeping hauing hir feete bound chaine concupiscence hir armes fast tied thorough euill vse hath power helpe remedie neither haue power crie succour perceiue helpe hope speciall grace god selfe deserue christ onelie sonne whose brightnesse giueth light darknesse whose power examining fault breaketh vaile ignorance giueth mee cleare vnderstanding thing abideth mee wherefore labour haue offended obeie seldome wherefore conuenient pride suppressed weeping hart sorowfull sigh humblie therefore confesse much lesse nothing birth mire dunghill hauing bodie prompt euill willing studie subiect care sorowe paine short life end vncertaine vnder sin adam sold lawe condemned selfe neuer yet power obserue one onelie commandement god force sinne therefore sinne whit lesse hidden cloaked dissembled sinne outwardlie increased within hart god would could hee would oft time desired performe thing doth constraine mee importable sorowe wearie raging life wish end miserable bodie desired death shall shall deliuer recouer anie good ala mortall man power strength deliuer onlie grace almightie god neuer slacke helpe penitent mercie oh maister without deseruing shew mercie sinner serued slothfullie without ceasing offended euerie daie yet slacke helping doth see euill haue much selfe doo nothing good hart bodie inclined contrarie feele strength vnlesse doo euill yet doth tarie till humblie praie seeing hell damnation doo crie vpon spirit whurling hart greater declare asketh mee gift whereof vertue vnknowne little power vnknowne gift whurling hart doth bring mee new desire shewing good haue lost sinne giuen againe thorough grace bountie hath ouercome sinne lord grace goodnesse doth put manie sinnes may see thou art full godlie loue make sinner thy seruant child ala god seeke thee fled ran awaie thee beneath thou camest downe mee nothing woorme earth naked doo saie woorme naie woorse woorme full pride deceit malice treason promise friend made baptised alwaies thorough faith thy passion feele mortification flesh dwell alwaies thee crosse thou wast fast nailed beleeue yeelded death dead also yeeld sinne haue oftentimes vntied taken downe set large haue broken denied falsified promise pride haue lifted vp maner sloth dutie towards thee forgotten much well profit value thee daie baptisme also thy sauing loue promise folowing haue alike neglected shall saie albeit oftentimes thou perceiuing mee wretched vnhappie hast giuen manie warning faith sacrament admonishing mee preaching comforted mee receiuing thy blessed bodie sacred bloud promising put number adorned perfect innocencie yet haue high benefit throwne forgetfulnesse oftentimes lord haue thee broken couenant partlie poore soule much fed euill bread damnable doctrine hypocrite despised succour ghostlie physicke god word would haue helped mee beene willing looke yet knew time teacher conuenient neither man saint angel without thy spirit change hart sinner ala good iesus thou beholding blindnesse neede could haue succour men didst open waie saluation great thy goodnesse inestimable sweetenesse thou hast shewed therein anie father naturall daughter brother sister would euer haue done thou hast done thou camest downe hel succour soule thy shee intending haue perished bicause loue thee ala sweet lord thou hast loued hir yea euen verie outshedding thy pretious bloud charitie feruent incomparable nothing slacke art thou loue louedst euerie sinner yea also thine enimies onelie forgiuing offence also giuing thy selfe saluation libertie deliuerance death crosse trauell paine sufferance cast mind occasion thy loue towards mee see nothing else loue woonderfull moueth thee giue deserue far foorth see ought giue thanks saluation onlie thee lord iesu owe praise thereof sauior creator second chapter soules affinitie christ thing god thou hast done much thou art onelie contented haue forgiuen sinnes also hast giuen vnto mee right fortunate gift grace suffice mee comming danger like stranger vsed thou doest handle soule durst say mother daughter sister wife notwithstanding lord trespasser woorthie come neere doore thy right high place aske bread thy dwelling oh grace suddenlie thou vouchsafest drawe soule highnes feeleth hir selfe ruler bodie poore ignorant lame doth find hir selfe thee rich wise strong bicause thou hast written hir hart roote thy spirit holie word giuing hir true faith receiue thing made hir conceiue thy sonne beleeuing man god sauiour also true forgiuer sinnes therefore doest thou assure hir shee mother thy sonne whome thou art onlie father furthermore father great loue thy well dooing thy holie sonne hath taken bodie man hath mingled himselfe ash thing may vnderstand without true faith hath pleased thee put neere v ioine himselfe flesh seeing called man bold call brother sith soule may saie hir selfe shee sister god ought haue hir selfe assured yes trulie thou doest declare great loue hir creation onlie thy good wil pleaseth thee alwaies haue towards hir giuing assurance hir first daie time prouided hir thou thorough loue hast made hir thou power alone canst well doo also didst put hir within bodie slacke sloth haue none exercise thinke doo seruice vnto thee truth maketh hir feele thee true paternitie honor sweetnesse glorie hath soule doeth alwaies remember thy daughter calling thee father shee doth thy commandement doth please thee giue hir another name call hir thy wife againe doo call thee husband declaring therby thou hast freelie manifested mariage hir baptisme hast thou made promise giue hir thy good rich take thee hir sinnes hath nothing heritage sinne hir first father adam hir treasure hath nature nothing else sinnes thou hast tied vpon crosse paid hir debt thy goodes land thou hast made hir rich great iointure endued hir knowing hir selfe thy wedded wife doth beleeue quit oweth esteeming verie little shee hath heere beneath forsaketh hir old father good giueth hir hir husband sake surelie god hurteth soule fed good againe releeued leauing pleasure world eternal peace without warre father ala ought thinke shall spirit bold take vpon call thee father yea also father hast thou taught pater noster call daughter hast thou said praie thee tell ala yea lord great sweetnes thou saiedst daughter lend thy hart againe thou saiedst daughter thy faith hath saued thee soule instead lending lord readie giue himselfe wholie vnto thee receiue permit anie creature put thee euer faithfull stedfastnesse may loue thee daughterlie loue lord thou father may thinke may thy mother indeede well perceiue conceiue thee createdst matter thou diddest satisfie doubt preaching stretching forth thy hand thou didst saie shall father brother sister mother beleue hearing reading word thou hast taught vttered thy holie prophet apostle also thy true preacher thou dost dailie declare vnto men beleeuing stedfastlie desiring fulfill conceiue thee beare thee loue therfore without anie feare wil take vpon name mother mother christ sweet virgine marie beseech thee angrie take vp title neither steale vsurpe anie thing vpon thy priuiledge thou onelie aboue woman receiuedst great honour man himselfe comprehend hath beene willing take thee flesh thou art mother perfect virgine holie birth thy blessed wombe thou didst beare nourish thou didst followe tribulation also teaching brieflie conclude thou hast god found grace enimie malice deceit caused adam posteritie lose eue haue lost sonne hath yeelded vnto v againe therefore hast thou bene rightfullie called full grace one whome lord hath shewed aboundant fauour sith best among good also spring goodnesse power hath created thee pure innocencie endued thee grace exalted thee dignitie thee example vertue hath builded dwelling temple loue confirme himselfe thee thou grace art confirmed therefore man giue thee greater praise god himselfe hath giuen thee praise commeth god thou also hast firme constant faith thou holie ghost wast filled godlinesse take vpon therefore giue thee greater praise honour thy sonne soueraigne lord hath giuen thee thou art corporall mother art thou thorough faith spirituall mother following thy faith humblenesse spirituall mother also ala god brotherlinesse thou hast towards thorough thy humblenesse calling sister great thou hast broken kindred mine old father calling daughter adoption seeing haue one father feare call thee brother thou hast reported wise salomon canticle saieng sister spouse thou hast wounded hart sweete looke one thine eies c ala brother wish nothing else wounding thee might finde selfe wounded thy loue would giue ouer selfe likewise thou doest call mee wife speaking amorous word arise deere doue come hitherward delectable spouse wherefore may saie louing faith thou art mine thine bicause thou hast called thy loue faire spouse hast thou made ala doth please thee giue name trulie able breake hart cause burne loue vnspeakeable thinketh vpon honour thou doest vnto soule much greater hath deserued mother mother ala child god sonne iesus speech mother daughter sister brother happie kindred sweetnesse doth proceede paternitie daughterlie reuerent feare ought haue towards father yea creator protector sauiour brother ala heere great loue therfore saie salomon hart longer refraine breake sunder make roome sweete brother none name written onlie name brother iesus sonne god none creature giue place scurging beating done vnto keepe hart deere brother loue let thine enimie enter third chapter soules infidelitie apostasie god sweete father child brother spouse hand ioined humblie vpon knee yeeld thee thanks praise pleaseth thee turne thy face towards conuerting hart couering grace thou doest see euils sinnes well hast thou hidden seemeth thou hast put forgetfulnesse yea also seeme forgotten haue done committed faith loue working causeth forget wholie putting trust thee alone father whome lieth vnfeigned loue whereof haue feare hart confesse haue done euill one creature doo selfe naught also haue offended thee prodigall child following foolish trade flesh wherewith haue prodigallie spent substance aboundance goodes thou heere hast giuen vse thy glorie mispending pouertie hath taken hath withered awaie euen haie yeelded spirit dead hunger compelling eate reliefe swine meates found verie little sauour seeing life miserable returne thee father againe saieng ala deere father haue sinned heauen thee therefore worthie called thy child bountifull mercifull father thou worsse one thy houshold seruants ala deere father loue zeale thou wouldest tarie comming praier speedilie stretching foorth thy hand receiuedst thinke thou wouldest looke receiuing stead haue punished thou didst assure saluation shall punish father shall denie sinne iudge condemne vnlesse god himselfe damne want goodnesse feare haue god father enimie shall harme father take strength awaie owe thing shall paie haue deserued death king shall pardon deliuer prison death heere woorst maner mother haue beene faith receiued name true mother became verie rude vnto thee sonne conceiued brought thee foorth left reason subiect taking heed vnto thee fell asleepe gaue place great enimie night ignorance asleepe steale thee craftilie thy place put hir child dead leese thee sorowfull remorse thus loose thee sonne mine owne fault tooke heed keepe thee sensualitie neighbour beeing beastlie sleepe steale thee gaue hir child life named sinne whome said would haue vtterlie forsake affirmed mine owne knew hirs soone came light grace thou hadst giuen knewe glorie changed saw dead child mine aliue taken awaie child apparant change betweene iesus sinne heere strange thing old woman causeth keepe dead child whome reporteth mine mainteine salomon thou true wise iudge thou hast heard lamentable processe ordeined content party child diuided two part false woman agreeth remembring mine owne sonne aliue rather content leese see bodie parted twaine true perfect loue neuer content one halfe loueth rather therefore weepe whole recouer one halfe without life ala noble salomon giue child aliue better die see sonne diuided lord thou didst better looke thou seeing anguish suffer rather forsake right behold cruelnesse thou saiedst true mother caused giue child againe whome hart sorowfull sweete iesus thus hast thou proued much loued thee yea sinne lost thee yet didst thou returne vnto ala gentlie doest thou vouchsafe come againe hir let sinne could keepe thee sweete child sweete sonne helper nourisher whome humble creature permit euer leaue thee againe repent time past come sensualitie thy rablement sinnes thou hast power make receiue thy dead child sonne strong defend shall permit thou take anie awaie strength greater anie others therefore may sleepe take rest neere thing well considered shall keepe thine assault sweete rest mother sonne together sweete child god onlie vnto thee honour praise euerie creature may see hath pleased thee call lesse nothing mother strange hard done ought thy goodnesse haue praise thou hast retained thy sister wherefore acknowledge selfe bound anie creature sister vnto thee naughtie sister better without name forget name adoption noble kindred also thy good brotherlie behauiour towards pride rise thee remembring fault going astraie thee agree aaron brother giue iudgement thy work folowing example miriam priuilie grudged thee thing caused haue remorse conscience ala right bountifull brother true moses doest goodnesse iustice haue esteemed thy workes euen sinne bold speake euen rashlie saieng wherefore hast thou maried strange woman thou giuest v law punishment fulfill thou wouldest bound forbidding v thing thou thy selfe doest thou forbiddest v kill anie man thou doest kill sparest none three thousand thou commandedst slaine god gaue v commandement thee marrie daughter stranger yet thou tookest thy wife among ala deere brother moses great manie word knowe foolish aaron miriam mine owne wit imbraided thee wherof repent liuelie voice god rebukinglie tooke vp went place wouldest thou sinne thou wouldest haue punished rather wouldest saluation health asking great benefit might please god mitigate iudgement thing thou couldest obtaine wherefore became lazar looked mee might well saie beene wise mine vncleannes leprosie put tent tabernacle among people sicke infect whole oh soule haue greater punishment banished companie holie god didst thou sweet loue brother seeing repentance thou prouidedst penance soone end true loue madest meanes wherevpon returned thee brother would stead punish foolish sister naturallie cleaue vnto hir iniurie grudge great offence hir committed thou giuest hir grace loue recompense ala brother exceeding thy loue much brotherhoode bound giue poore wretched woman haue done thee euill thou giuest good thine thou saiest thou art mine euen euer feare great foolishnesse aaron miriam man may separate thee together brother sister care little thy land mine inheritance let v keepe please thee one houshold sith hath pleased thee humble thy selfe much ioine thy hart mine making thy selfe liuelie man right hartilie thanke thee thanke thee ought lieth power take meaning praie thee excuse mine ignorance seeing great kindred thy sister god haue good cause loue praise serue thee vnfeignedlie feare desire anie thing saue thee onlie keepe well humblie praie thee aske none brother friend helpe anie father haue anie pitie vpon child anie mother haue taken anie care hir sonne anie brother haue hid sinne sister thou fourth chapter entier affection loue god towards sinfull soule man neuer sawe else kept wondrous secret euer anie husband would thoroughlie forgiue wife offended returne vnto haue beene manie auenge wrong haue caused iudges put death beholding sinnes spare owne hand kill also seeing fault appeare send home owne friend perceiuing euill disposition haue shut vp prison brieflie conclude vpon diuers complexion end pretence punishment least harme euer could perceiue punishing would neuer see againe wish mind rather helpe turne forsake therfore god find man comparable vnto thee loue thou art perfect example therefore confesse lowlie hart haue broken thee mine oth promise ala thou hadest chosen thy wife didst set vp great state honour greater honour may one haue place thy wife sweetelie taketh hir rest neere thee onlie suretie soule bodie also thy goodes queene mistresse ladie great fauour vile creature ennoblished thee honourable husband speake brieflie haue possessing thee anie man mortall desire yet remember mine vnwoorthie deseruing hart doth sob sigh mine eies let fall abundance teares mouth make manie exclamation neither new ancient writing shew pitifull case tell shall dare tell may pronounce without shame yea confusion shew great loue husband worship declare fault sauiour wast crucified crosse sinnes deede thine father leaue sonne child offend mother sister chide grudge ala fault far greater familiaritie haue thee benefit receiue thee greater mine offence thee dissemble speciallie doo called thy spouse loued thee thy soule shall tell truth spouse haue left thee forgotten thee run awaie thee leaue thee go vaine pleasure forsooke thee chose another yea refused thee welspring goodnesse faithfull promise leaue thee whither went place nothing cursednesse haue left thee trustie friend louer worthie beloued aboue others haue put thee aside welspring health somnes mine owne wretched yea haue forsaken thee full beautie goodnesse wisedome power sought withdrawe thy loue haue accepted thy great enimies diuell world flesh whome sake thou foughtedst sore crosse set libertie long time prisoner slaue bound man could cause humble selfe loue charitie haue towards thee quench name jesus deare husband found sweet tedious hatefull oftentimes iest haue heard gospell preached taught word haue hard hath tarried feather doth winde went neuer yet heare thy word preached fashion onlie worke hypocrisie also annoied hard speake thee willing go pleasure brieflie conclude thou didst forbid fulfilled thou commandedst eschue cause loued thee yet lord thus hate thee forsake thee ran awaie thee betraied thee giue place anie hast thou suffered mocked either yet beaten killed hast thou put darke prison banished euer setting naught hast thou taken awaie thy gift pretious iewels againe punish vnfaithfull fruit haue lost iointure thou promisedst mine owne offence done thee accused thee afore eternall father naughtie woman hast thou forbidden thy presence haue deserued neuer appeare thine house true husband pure perfect friend louing among louers ala thou hast done otherwise thou hast diligentlie sought going deepe place hell euils done farthest thee hart mind directlie waie didst thou louinglie call backe saieng deare daughter hearken see vow thine eare toward forget strange nation whome thou hast run astraie also house thine owne father thou hast dwelt long shall king faithfulnesse desire thy beautie thou lord sawest thy sweete gratious calling profit begannest thou crie lowd voice saieng come vnto wearilie loden labour shall plentiouslie refresh feed bread life ala sweet lord vnto sweet word would hearken rather doubted whether thou spake vnto else fabulous writing said foolish without loue read thy word considered comparison uineyard brought foorth thornes brier stead good fruit signified done knew also thou didst call barren wife saieng returne shulamite thou didst speake forsake sinnes yet word though vnderstood neuer whit perused prophet ieremie confesse reading thereof feare hart bashfulnesse face tell yea teares mine eies lord thine honor suppresse pride thou hast said holie prophet woman haue offended hir husband left going astraie therevpon refuseth hir esteemed polluted value lawe doth consent put hir hand iustice driue hir awaie neuer take hir againe thou hast made separation betweene thy bed mine saith vnto placed forren louers roome committing fornication yet thou maist returne againe alwaies angrie thee lift vp therfore thine eies looke thee euerie side shalt thou well see place thy sinne hath lead thee filthilie thou liest earth poore soule looke thy sinne hath put thee euen vpon high way thou didst waite tarie beguile came euen theefe doth hidden wildernesse therefore thou fulfilling thy wicked pleasure hast fornication infected earth thee thine eies thy forehead thy face haue lost good maner harlot hath yet thou hadest shame thy sinne surplus ieremie saith constreineth knowe wretched life wish sorowfull sighes houre moneth daie yeare time life might haue end yeelding selfe condemned worthie lie euer euerlasting fire feare proceedeth thee selfe putteth rather hope despaire often remember sinne soone thou knowest bowing vnder thine obedience putting liuelie faith thou didst vse great clemencie knewe thee lord maister king whome ought haue feared found feare quenched mixed loue beleeuing thou art gratious gentle sweete pitifull husband rather haue hid haue shewed selfe feare go foorth looke thee seeking found thee didst thou didst thou refuse lord rather hast excused hast thou turned thy face thine eie sweetlie penetrated hart wounding almost death giue remorse sinnes thou hast put backe thy hand thine armes sweet manlie hart thou didst meete waie reprouing fault embracedst could see beholding thy countenance euer thou didst perceiue mine offence wherefore thou hast done much though neuer broken promise thee thou didst hide fault euerie bodie giuing againe part thy bed also shewing multitude sinnes hidden ouercome thy great victorie thou wilt neuer remember thou seest nothing grace gift vertues hath pleased thy free goodnesse giue charitie pretious see well thy goodnesse doth consume lewdnesse maketh new godlie ioifull creature euill mine thou hast destroied made perfect creature good husband wife thou hast done giuing faithfull hope thy promise haue thy good grace recouered place thy wife happie desired place gratious bed thou right honourable seate peace rest warre high sleepe honour separate earth doest thou receiue vnworthie creature giuing hir scepter crowne thine empire glorious realme euer heare storie raise vp one high hir selfe nothing maketh great valure selfe naught fift chapter vnion death life faithfull soule christ ala casting mine eies high see thy goodnes thine vnknowne grace thy loue incomprehensible sight woonderfull beholding thee looking downeward might see willing ala see lewdenesse darkenesse extreme deepenes mine euils death humblenes closeth mine eie admirable goodnesse thee vnspeakable euill thy right highnes pure maiestie right fragill mortall nature thy gift good beatitude malice great vnkindnes good art thou vnto vnking haue bene vnto thee thou wilt pursue thing considered causeth maruell pleaseth thee ioine thy selfe seeing comparison betweene v thou art god thy worke thou creator thy creature speake brieflie though cannot define thee yet know selfe least thing may compared vnto thee happie loue thou madest agreement thou didst ioine life death together ye vnion hath made aliue death life dieng life without end haue made death life death hath giuen vnto life quickning yt death dead may receiue life death rauished aliue liue otherwise self dead concerning bodelie death nothing comming prison death life death aliue mortall life filleth full care sorowe death yeeldeth content godlie thing die soule may liue deliuering hir mortall death deliuered death miserable matched hir mightie louer soule blamelesse faine would haue life yes trulie ought call death hir welbeloued friend sweet death pleasant sorowe mightie king deliuering wickednes lord trust thee thy death mortified hope haue thy passion thus sweet sleepe dost thou put death causeth manie lament happie sleepe vnto awaketh doth find thy death life euerlasting death none thing christian man libertie deliuerance mortall band death fearefull wicked pleasant acceptable good bicause death death destroied therefore god rightlie taught call death life end labour beginning euerlasting ioie knowe long life doth let sight thee death come doe thine office may see spouse else sweet loue transforme thee shall better tarie comming death sweet lord let die may liue thee none deliuer thou onelie sauiour faith planted ioined thee vnion sith faith assured thee may call thee father brother sonne husband father paternitie brother fraternitie child delectation spouse coniunction father full humilitie brother hauing similitude sonne engendred faith loue husband louing releeuing extremitie dost thou loue ala thou hast withdrawne snare wherin malice bound hast put hir place name office daughter sister mother wife sauiour great sauour sweetnesse right pleasant delectable soule hearing thy word shall cal thee without feare father brother child spouse soule doubtlesse may continuallie burne loue anie loue vnlesse maner loue hath euill condition anie pleasure hereto compared anie honour may accounted shame yea anie profit equall moreouer conclude thing could earnestlie loue ala vnfeinedlie loueth god reputeth thing wordlie lesse valure dunghill pleasure profit honour world vanitie trifle vnto hath found god loue profitable honourable abundant grace dare saie onlie sufficeth hart godlie soule yeeldeth hir constant neuer desireth would haue whosoeuer hath god ought accounteth thing superfluous vaine thanked lord father faith haue gotten loue wherfore ought satisfied content haue thee father defence want foolishnes long youth haue thee brother succour sorowes wherein find end haue thee sonne feeble age onlie staie haue thee true faithfull husband satisfieng whole hart sith haue thee doo forsake world holding thee fast thou maiest escape seeing haue possessed thee look vpon none thing might keepe backe beholding thy diuinitie seeing doo heare thee heare nothing letteth fruition thy voice seeing may freelie talke thee common none seeing pleaseth thee put neere thee rather die touch anie seeing serue thee serue none seeing thou hast ioined thy hart mine depart thee let punished euer departing thy loue harder damnation doo feare paine ten thousand hel doo feare loosing thee ala god father creator doo thou suffer enimie inuenter sinne haue anie power make mee loose thy presence whosoeuer shall feele losse thy loue shall saie would rather bound euer hell feele paine thereof one moment time sauiour doo thou permit euer depart thee againe may please thee put place soule wantonnesse sinne neuer separated thy loue sixt chapter longing soule death feede christ world perfectlie haue desire thing maketh mee feruentlie desire departing bodie sinne fearing death anie hir instrument feare ought haue god loue offered himselfe suffered death debt dutie onlie bicause would sake vnder power mortall death iesus dead dead death shall liue meane faith partaker passion euen death great mysterie crosse hard euerie man man feared therewith considering copulation bodie soule order loue agreement sorowes extreme departing one since hath pleased sweet lambe offer himselfe vpon crosse great loue hath kindled fire within hart vehement euerie true beleeuer esteemeth passage death plaie pastime prouoketh constantlie die euen feare death doth retrograde v ought loue giue v desire die true loue vnfainedlie within hart man feele none thing bicause loue strong selfe keepeth room putteth desire suffering nothing god onlie wheresoeuer true perfect loue remembred neither feare sorowe yet owne pride attaine honour causeth v seeke death manie strange way man haue foolish pleasure putteth himselfe ieopardie life merchant obtaine rich doth danger himselfe somtime small value theefe conceiuing roberie murther crueltie deceit doth blind man doubteth nothing danger death neither yet misfortune seeketh aduenge himselfe doth euill furie sicknesse rankenesse melancholie causeth man fiercelie wish death oftentimes drowne hang kill themselues euils sometimes great cause pained patient choose death libertie paine full euils imperfection cause feare hazard way allowed scripture may thankfull thus feele selfe come new garment god mercie taken iust righteous late without mercie sinfull wicked faith obteine mercie vnfaithfull enioie although iohn extolleth charitie epistle saieng god charitie dwelleth charitie dwelleth god truelie charitie maketh men liue like angel furious vnbrideled carnall men maketh meeke lambes yea feruent spirit ought call crie praie lord make great charitie burne flame hart stonie euill affected neuer would conceiue regard great inestimable charitie loue god sending onlie begotten deere beloued sonne vale miserie suffer cruell sharpe death crosse redemption yea neuer vnspeakeable high charitie abundant loue god printed fixed hart duelie till pleased god meere grace mercie pittie open mine eies making see behold eie liuelie faith christ crucified mine onelie sauiour redeemer began perceiue see mine owne ignorance blindnesse cause thereof would learne knowe christ sauiour redeemer god meere goodnesse thus opened mine eies made see behold christ wisedome god light world supernaturall sight faith pleasure vanity honor rich wealth aid world began waxe bitter vnto knew illusion diuell false ne humane doctrine receiued successe came thereof detestation horrour erst much loued esteemed god forbidden loue world vaine pleasure shadowes began perceiue christ onlie sauior redeemer doctrine diuine holie heauenlie infused grace hart faithfull neuer attained hnmane doctrine wit reason although trauell labour end world began dwell god charitie knowing louing charitie god remission sinnes god charitie iohn saith faith whereby came knowe god whereby pleased god euen bicause trusted iustifie sprang excellent charitie hart thinke lesse manie woonder maruell saieng neuer knewe christ sauiour redeemer vntill time many haue opinion saieng knoweth christ christian doth confesse sauiour thus beleeuing dead humane historicall faith knowledge haue learned scholasticall bookes true infused faith knowledge christ may said sinne vse saie owne experience themselues faith doth iustifie true except haue faith haue declared shall neuer iustified yet false faith onlie sure iustified euen cause manie impugne office dutie true faith bicause manie lacke true faith euen faithfull forced allow true faith vnfaithfull wise probablie intreate thereof one feeling himselfe saith hauing saie haue certeinlie curious learning defend matter withall simple zeale earnest loue truth inspired god promiseth powre spirit vpon flesh haue grace god humblie honour felt selfe true fourth chapter great loue god towards mankind inward beholding christ crucified let v therfore praie faith behold consider great charitie goodnesse god sending sonne suffer death redemption mortall enimies sort maner sent first considered yea vndoubtedlie perfect faith beleeued god sent v freelie giue sold noble rich gift could haue giuen sent seruant friend onlie sonne deerelie beloued delight rich honour cross pouerties slander lord seruant yea vile painefull passion wash v water owne pretious bloud mire puddle filth iniquity hath giuen make v poore enrich v diuine vertues merit grace yea hath giuen v good thing finallie himselfe opened vnto v although weake blind selues may behold miserable estate great wisedome goodnesse truth godlie perfection christ therefore inwardlie behold christ crucified vpon crosse best godliest tabernacle mansion inestimable incomprehensible maiestie honour god see also christ crucified vaine foolish world christ wise despised see also blind knoweth christ persecuteth see also vnkind world cruell hard wicked euill world may also christ crucified weigh sinnes diuine ballance greeuous weightie seeing haue crucified christ would neuer haue beene counterpaised great pretious weight bloud sonne god therefore god high goodnesse determined blessed sonne rather suffer bloudshead thau sinnes haue condemned v shall neuer knowe owne miserie wretchednesse light christ crucified shall see owne crueltie feele mercie owne vnrighteousnesse iniquitie see righteousnes holinesse therefore learne knowe trulie owne sinnes studie booke crucifixe continuall conuersation faith haue perfect plentifull thanks great benefit fift chapter glorious victory christ ouer enimies looke booke shall see christ great victorie vpon crosse noble mightie neuer neither shall victorie glorie worldlie prince great prudence prince world neuer fight without strength world christ contrarilie went warre euen strength world fought dauid golias vnarmed humane wisdome policie without worldlie power strength neuerthelesse fullie replenished armed whole armour spirit one battell ouercame euer enimies neuer glorious spoile neither rich noble christ vpon crosse deliuered elect sharpe miserable captiuitie battell manie stripe yea lost life victorie much greater therfore looke vpon sonne god supernaturall faith light vnarmed naked giuen vp alone humilitie patience liberalitie modestie gentlenesse diuine vertues beating downe ground god enimies making soule man faire beautifull forced saie victorie triumph maruellous therefore christ well deserued haue noble title iesvs nazareth king iewes particularlie vnfold see great victory let v first behold ouercame sinne innocencie confounded pride humilitie quenched worldlie loue charitie appeased wrath father meekenesse turned hatred loue manie benefit godlie zeale christ hath onlie ouercome sinne rather hath killed asmuch hath satisfied himselfe holie sacrifice oblation pretious bodie suffering bitter cruell death also another sort giueth loue much spirit grace vertue strength may resist impugne ouercome sinne consent neither suffer reigne hath also vanquished sinne hath taken awaie force hath cancelled lawe euill men occasion sinne therefore sinne hath power holie ghost vnited christ nothing worthie damnation although dreg adam remaine concupiscence deede sinnes neuerthelesse imputed sinnes trulie planted christ true christ might haue taken awaie immoderate affection hee hath left great glorie father owne greater triumph example prince fighteth enimies sometime souereigntie ouer people subduing may kill yet preserueth saueth whereas lord ouer people maketh serue whome ruled case prince doth shew himselfe greater conquerour hath made ruler obeie subiects lord ouer whome serued vtterlie destroied vpon conquest leaueth continuall victorie whome redeemed whereas otherwise occasion victorie taken awaie none left subiects euen like case christ hath left v concupiscence intent serue v exercise vertues first reigne ouer v exercise sinne may plainelie seene whereas first impediment v could moue selues towards god christ haue much strength notwithstanding force may assuredlie walke heauen although child god sometime fall fariltie sinne yet falling maketh humble themselues reknowledge goodnesse god come refuge helpe likewise christ death hath ouercome prince diuels hoast hath destroied paule saith verified christ breake serpent head prophesied god although diuell tempt v yet faith planted christ shall perish rather temptation take great force might euident triumph victorie glorie christ greater hauing sort subdued diuell whereas prince lord world holding creature captiuitie christ vseth instrument punish wicked exercise make strong elect god christian warfare christ likewise hath ouercome death glorious manner possible hath taken awaie leauing vniuersallie subiect hath giuen much vertue spirit whereas afore passed thereto great feare bold spirit sure hope resurrection receiue ioie bitter sweete feared desired death life also hath pleased god infirmity aduersities remaine sight world child god christ made strong righteous whole sound trouble world comfort spirit passion flesh medicine soule maner thing worke commoditie profite spirit feele god father doth gouerne disposeth thing benefit therefore feele themselues sure persecution quiet peacefull trouble without weerinesse feares anxiety suspicion misery finallie good euill world worketh commoditie moreouer see triumph christ hath beene great onelie hath subdued vanquished enimies power hath ouerthrowne vanquished sort thing serue helth might could haue taken awaie haue beene victorie palme crowne dailie haue fight flesh succour grace haue continuall victory ouer sinne whereby haue cause glorifie god sonne hath weakened enimie diuell spirit giueth v strength vanquish ofspring doo knowledge dailie great triumph sauiour reioice owne fight wise impute anie wisdome world seeing sinne increase worldlie wisedome gouerneth sinne ruleth world enimie god also wisdome therof aduerse god therefore christ hath declared discouered foolishnesse although could haue taken awaie worldlie wisedome yet hath left greater glorie triumph chosen vessel whereas ruler god christ serued god slaue worldlie thing albeit supernaturall thing vnderstood anie time men would impugne gainsaie v wisedome world yet haue christ much supernaturall light truth make mocke repugne truth christ also vpon crosse hath triumphed ouer world first bicause hath discouered naught whereas couered vaile hypocrisie vesture morall vertues christ hath shewed god sight righteousnesse world wickednesse hath yeelded witnes work men regenerated faith euill christ hath iudged condemned world naught hath giuen much light spirit knowe dispraise yea tread vnder foot vaine honour dignity pleasure taking faire promise neither offer doth present naie rather make scorne threatnings force world nothing feare therefore may see great victorie triumph noble highlie happie glorious triumphant waie tongue expressed therefore forced saie triumph maruellous also seene knowne christ true messias hath deliuered man euils man hath goodnesse true messias therefore helper vaine counterfeited sauiours seeing messias christ wholie onlie deliuered euils haue goodnesse true euident cleare bicause verie true christian christian christ true christian feeleth example lesson v followe time season well prosperitie aduersitie haue god committing leauing care greefes abandon policy inuentions vaine foolish indeed verie shadowes dreames yet carnall fleshlie run headlong like vnbrideled colt without snaffle bridle loue god printed hart would keepe v backe running astraie vntill time please god send v bit hold v shall neuer run right waie although wee speake talke neuer much god word true follower christ doctrine haue alwaies respect eie vocation called ministerie god word preach teach sincerelie edifieng others shew themselues liuing follower maried men hauing child familie nourish bring vp without bitternesse fiercenesse doctrine lord godlinesse vertue committing instruction others apperteine charge reformation god minister chieflie king prince compared great heape burning coales god knoweth intent mind haue lamented mine owne sinnes fault world trust bodie iudge haue done praise thanke anie creature since rather might ashamed reioice rehearsall thereof knewe little esteeme weigh praise world opinion soone remooued taken awaie thanke god grace knowe world blind iudge praise therof vaine little moment therefore seeke praise neither satisfie none otherwise taught christ doo according christian charitie would god would occasion doth serue confesse fault world respect owne commoditie laid apart ala selfeloue doth much reigne among vnquiet lord iesu beseech thee euerie place time let speciall solace gladlie thy loue lacke worldlie solace thou withdrawe thy comfort time keepe lord desperation make patientlie abide thy ordinance lord iesu thy iudgments righteous thy prouidence much better imagine deuise wherfore doo thing shall please thee may well thou dooest thou wilt light thou blessed thou wilt darknesse thou also blessed thou vouchsafe comfort thou highlie blessed thou wilt liue trouble without comfort thou like wise euer blessed lord giue mee grace gladlie suffer whatsoeuer thou wilt shall fall vpon patientlie take thy hand good bad bitter sweete ioie sorrowe thing shall befall vnto hartilie thanke thee keepe lord sinne shall neither dread death hell thanks ought giue vnto thee hast suffered greeuous death crosse deliuer sinnes obtaine euerlasting life thou gauest v perfect example patience fulfilling obeieng thy father euen vnto death make wretched sinner obedientlie vse selfe thy althings patientlie beare burden corruptible life though life tedious heauie burden soule yet neuerthelesse thorough thy grace example thee made much easie comfortable thine incarnation passion thy holie life waie thee following thee walke thee art head sauiour yet except thou hadst gone shewed v waie euerlasting life would endeuor himselfe followe thee seeing yet slowe dull hauing light thy blessed example holie doctrine leade direct v lord iesu make possible grace impossible nature thou knowest well may litle suffer anon cast downe ouerthrowne little aduersitie wherfore beseech thee lord strengthen thy spirit may willinglie suffer thy sake maner trouble affliction second chapter confession infirmity desire rest god aboue thing lord knowledge vnto thee mine vnrighteousnesse confesse thee vnstablenesse hart oftentimes verie little thing troubleth sore maketh mee dull slowe serue thee sometime purpose stand stronglie little trouble commeth mee great anguish greefe right little thing riseth greeuous temptation mee yea thinke selfe bee sure strong seemeth haue vpper hand suddenlie feele selfe readie fall little blast temptation behold therefore good lord weakenesse consider frailenesse best knowne thee haue mercie deliuer iniquitie sinne bee intangled therewith oft time greeueth mee sore maner confoundeth mee vnstable weake fraile resisting sinfull motion although drawe alwaie consent yet neuerthelesse assault bee verie greeuous vnto mee tedious mee liue battell albeit perceiue battell vnprofitable vnto mee thereby knowe better selfe mine owne infirmity must seeke helpe onlie thy hand lord god israel louer faithfull soules vouchsafe behold labour sorowe mee thy poore creature assist mee thing thy grace strengthen heauenlie strength neither cruell enimie feend neither wretched flesh yet subiect spirit haue victorie dominion ouer mee life may bee called trouble miserie lacketh euerie place full snare mortall enimies one trouble temptation ouerpassed another commeth first conflict yet new battell suddenlie ariseth wherefore lord iesu praie thee giue thy grace rest thee aboue thing quiet mee thee aboue creature aboue glorie honour aboue dignitie power aboue cunning policie aboue health beautie aboue rich treasure aboue ioie pleasure aboue fame praise aboue mirth consolation man hart may take feele besides thee thou lord god art best wise high mightie sufficient full goodnesse sweet comfortable faire louing noble glorious goodnes perfectlie therefore whatsoeuer haue besides thee nothing mee hart may rest ne fullie bee pacified onlie thee lord iesu louing spouse shall giue mee wing perfect loue may flie vp worldlie misery rest thee shall ascend thee feele sweet thou art shall wholie gather selfe thee perfectlie shall thy loue feele selfe thee onlie aboue selfe aboue worldlie thing thou maist vouchsafe visit mee wise thou dooest visit thy faithfull louers often mourne complaine misery life sorowe great heauinesse suffer manie thing happen dailie mee oftentimes trouble mee make mee heauie darken mine vnderstanding hinder mee greatlie put mind thee encumber manie way freelie cleerelie desire thee ne haue thy sweet consolation thy blessed saint alwaie present beseech thee lord iesu sighings inward desire hart may moue incline thee heare mee third chapter recounting god benefit praier obtaine free cleane mind helpe lord god shall feare ne dread trouble euer fall vpon shall saie thy done haue deserued troubled greeued therefore behooueth suffer long pleaseth thee would god might suffer gladlie till furious tempest ouerpassed quietnesse hart might come againe thy mightie hand lord strong ynough take trouble asswage cruell assault thereof thou hast oftentimes done time cleerelie deliuered thee may crucified perfectlie dead yet striueth flesh spirit moueth great battell inwardlie suffereth kingdome soule liue peace thou good lord hast lordship ouer power sea asswage rage surge arise helpe destroie power mine enimies alwaies make battell shew foorth greatnesse thy goodnesse let power thy right hand glorified none helpe refuge thee onlie lord god thee honour glorie euerlasting lord grant may wholie resigne myselfe thee thing forsake selfe patientlie beare crosse followe thee lord man thou vouchsafest haue mind visit thou art alwaie one alwaie good alwaie righteous holie iustlie blessedlie disposing thing thy wisdome wretch selfe alwaie readie prone euill neuer abide one state manie tune doo varie change neuerthelesse shall better shall please thee thou lord onelie art maiest helpe thou maiest confirme stablish hart shall changed thee surelie fixed finallie rest quieted thee nothing else selfe vanitie thee vnconstant creature feeble therefore whereof may rightfullie glorie looke magnified pleaseth himselfe without thee displeaseth thee delighteth men praisings looseth true praise thee true praise praised thee true ioie reioice thee wherefore thy name lord praised mine thy work magnified mine thy goodnesse alwaies lauded blessed thou art glorie ioie hart thee shall glorie reioice selfe anie worldlie honor dignitie thine eternall glorie compared shadowe verie vanitie within without euerie side stedfast sure lord iesu shall stand behold thee haue full sight contemplation thy glorie shalt thou shall thee thy kingdome thou hast ordeined thine elect people beginning left poore outlawe land mine enimies dailie battels great misfortune comfort mine exile asswage sorowe desire thee vnpleasant burden pleasure soeuer world offereth desire haue inward fruition thee strongly resist ouercome motion occasion sinne helpe thou euerlasting truth worldlie guile vanitie hereafter haue power deceiue come also thou heauenlie sweetnesse let bitternesse sinne flie far pardon forgiue oft praier mind surelie fixed thee manie time stand sit rather whither thought carie thought customablie thought loue oftentimes commeth mind custome pleaseth best delighteth thinke vpon accordinglie thou dost say thy gospell man treasure hart wherefore loue heauen speake gladlie therof thing god apperteineth honour glorie holie name loue world loue talke worldlie thing ioie anon worldlie felicitie sorowe lament soone worldlie aduersitie loue flesh imagine oftentimes pleaseth flesh loue soule delight much speake heare thing soules health whatsoeuer loue gladlie heare speake beare image still mind blessed man loue lord setteth pleasure world learneth trulie ouercome himselfe feruour spirit crucifieth flesh cleane pure conscience may offer praiers thee accepted haue companie thy blessed angel earthlie thing excluded hart sixt chapter sweet praier wherein pressed downe trouble humblie yeeld selues vnder mightie hand god creator lord holie father thou blessed euer thou wilt done thou dooest alwaie best let thine humble vnwoorthie seruant ioie onelie thee selfe ne anie thing else besides thee thou lord art gladnes hope crowne mine honour hath thy seruant hath thee without hir desert thing thine thou hast created made poore haue beene trouble paine euer youth soule hath beene great heauinesse manifold passion come world flesh wherefore lord desire may haue thee ioie inward peace aske thee come rest ordeined thy chosen child fed nourished light heauenlie comfort without thy helpe come thee lord giue peace giue inward ioie soule shall full heauenlie melodie deuout feruent thy lauds praise thou withdrawe thy selfe thou hast sometime done may thy seruant runne waie thy commandements lampe thy ghostlie presence shine vpon head defended vnder shadowe thy wing peril danger mercifull lord iesu euer praised time come thou wilt prooue thy seruant rightfull shall suffer somewhat thee houre come thou hast knowne beginning thy seruant time outwardlie set naught inwardlie leane vnto thee despised sight world broken affliction may arise thee new light clarified made glorious kingdome heauen holie father thou hast ordeined done thou hast commanded thy grace lord thy freend suffer hir troubled world thy loue often euer person euer maner soeuer thou wilt suffer fall vnto hir without thy sufferance thing done vpon earth good lord thou hast meekened may therby learne knowe thy righteous iudgements put maner presumption statelinesse hart verie profitable confusion hath couered face may learne thereby rather seeke thee helpe succour man haue thereby learned dread thy secret terrible iudgements scourgest righteous sinner without equitie iustice lord yeeld thanks thee thou hast spared sinnes hast punished scourge loue hast sent affliction anguish within without creature vnder heauen may comfort thou lord god heauenlie leach man soule strikest healest bringest man nigh vnto death restorest life againe may thereby learne knowe owne weakenesse imbecillitie fullie trust lord thy discipline laid vpon thy rod correction hath taught vnder rod wholie submit strike backe bone shall please thee make bow crooked thy make meeke humble disciple thou hast sometime done may walke thy thee commit selfe corrected better corrected thee heere time come thou knowest thing nothing hid thee man conscience thou knowest thing come fall needfull anie man teach thee warne thee anie thing done vpon earth thou knowest profitable much tribulation helpe purge awaie rust sinne doo thy pleasure sinfull wretch none well knowne thee grant lord knowe necessarie knowne loue loued desire pleaseth thee regard pretious thy sight refuse vile thee suffer iudge thy mystery mine outward sens ne giue sentence hearing ignorant true iudgement discerne thing spirituall aboue thing alwaie search followe thy pleasure lord iesu thou art rich haue haue thee lord dare speake thee thy poore creature worme abiect behold lord haue naught selfe naught worth thou art onlie god righteous holie thou orderest thing thou giuest thing thou fulfillest thing goodnesse sinner barren void godlie vertues remember thy mercy fill hart plentie thy grace thou wilt thy work made vaine may beare miserie life except thy grace mercie comfort turne thy face deferre visiting ne withdrawe thy comfort least happilie soule made drie earth without water grace teach lord fulfill thy liue meekelie worthilie thee thou art wisdome cunning thou art knowest knewest world made borne brought life thee lord honour glorie praise euer euer amen p certaine effectuall praier made ladie jane dudley time hir trouble little hir death lord thou god father life heare mee poore desolate woman flieth vnto thee onelie trouble misery thou lord art onlie defender deliuerer put trust thee therefore defiled sinne incumbred affliction vnquieted trouble wrapped care ouerwhelmed misery vexed temptation greeuouslie tormented long imprisonment vile masse claie sinfull bodie bloud come vnto thee mercifull sauiour crauing thy mercie helpe without little hope deliuerance left may vtterlie despaire anie libertie albeit expedient seeing life standeth vpon trieng visited sometime aduersitie wherby might tried whether thy flocke also knowe thee selues better yet thou saidst thou wouldst suffer v tempted aboue power mercifull vnto miserable wretch beseech thee salomon crie vnto thee humblie desiring thee may neither much puffed vp prosperitie neither much pressed downe aduersitie least full denie god lowe brought despaire blaspheme thee lord sauiour mercifull god consider miserie best knowne vnto thee thou vnto strong tower defence humblie require thee suffer tempted aboue strength power either thou deliuerer vnto great miserie either else giue grace patientlie beare thy heauie hand sharpe correction thy right hand god yt deliuered people israel hand pharao space four hundred yeares oppresse keepe bondage let therefore like wise seeme good thy fatherlie goodnes deliuer sorowfull wretch whome thy sonne christ shed pretious bloud crosse miserable captiuitie bondage wherein long wilt thou absent euer oh lord hast thou forgotten gratious hast thou shut vp thy louing kindnesse displeasure wilt thou intreated thy mercie cleane gone euer thy promise come vtterlie end euermore doest thou make long tarieng shall despaire thy mercie oh god far thy workemanship created christ iesu giue grace therefore tarie thy leasure patientlie beare thy work assuredlie knowing thou canst thou wilt deliuer shall please thee nothing doubting mistrusting thy goodnesse towards thou wotest better good doo therefore doo thing thou wilt plague waie thou wilt onelie meane time arme beseech thee thine armour yt may stand fast loines girded veritie hauing brestplate righteousnes shod shoe prepared gospell peace aboue thing taking shield faith wherewith may able quench firie dart wicked taking helmet saluation sword spirit thy holie word praieng alwaies sister iane dudley certaine verse written said ladie iane pinne non aliena putes homini quae obtingere possunt sors hodierna mihi cras erit illa tibi iane dvdley deo iuuante nil nocet liuor malus et last word lord thy hand command spirit p morning euening praiers diuers psalmes hymnes meditation made set forth ladie elizabeth tyrwhit confession said morning praier doo acknowledge confesse vnto thee mercifull heauenlie father mine often grieuous offence haue committed thy diuine maiestie youth hitherto thought word deed leauing vndone thing ought haue done dooing thing ought haue done prouoking thy wrath indignation lamenting wickednes appeale vnto thy mercie saie publicane lord god mercifull vnto wretched sinner forgiue past saue defend euill confirme good life glorie thy name praier said vprising doo thanke thee mercifull heauenlie father thy deerelie beloued sonne iesu christ night thou hast giuen sleepe rest preseruing hurt perill crie thee mercie mine offence humblie beseech thee thou wilt likewise daie keepe sinne euill thought word work may please thee doo commit selfe bodie soule thing go thy hand beseeching thee thine holie spirit may abide least deadlie aduersarie diuell haue power ouer amen another praier vprising oblessed iesu daie commend proceeding thy hand daie humbly praie thee helpe hast made thine owne image thy bloud hast clensed art hope heauiuinesse comfort care trust trouble although sweete lord conscience accuseth lawe condemneth yet thy pretious death testament hath deliuered thee reigne glorie death hath arrested earth consumed yet good lord trust resnrrection dwell thee eternallie thy promise made doo beleeue thee call vpon thy holie name thy kingdome come daie sathan deliuer bread angel feede fleshlie lust purge sudden death deadlie sinne lord take giue hart beleeue thee sens may obey thee thy mercie accept praiers daie thee art one god trinitie honour glorie amen hymne praier sonne god beamie sun large light doth giue chase away night blesse v thy benefit endue v thy spirit sweet dew fro heuen earth god grant peace quiet mind may serue liuing god statute doo bind mightie lord helpe need driue far awaie feend sinne hell doo v molest life shall eend thou art euer lasting daie shinst euerie place feedest euerie liuing wight plentious gift grace thy heauenlie hand deere god spirit doo commend day sin sathans power thy seruant defend laud thee father thy grace praise sonne made v free thanke holie spirit solace one god person three antheme deerlie beloued sonne god spare v deliuered shall giue v thing also praier god father vsed morning praier mercifull father teaching v praie thy sonne christ hast commanded v call thee father beleeue thy beloued child stirrest vp none thine praie intent thou wouldest heare giuing vnto v also thing effectuallie plentiouslie either aske thinke beseech thee thy sonnes sake giue v grace beleeue knowe assuredlie thy sonne sauiour christ giuen thee vnto v sauiour righteousnesse wisdome holines redemption satisfaction lord suffer v trust anie saluation thy sonne sauiour iesus christ hymne redemption christ praise father louinglie gentlie v preserued forsooke wretchedlie death sinne deserued mercie bountious though fell freelie christ pardoned v v redeemd hell glorie trinitie father sonne spirit liuing art one god person three praise without ending amen forme priuate morning praier father art heauen c lord open thou lip mouth may speake shew foorth thy glorie praise shut mouth speaking anie thing whereby offend thy diuine maiestie hurtfull neighbor god make speede saue v lord make haste helpe v glorie father sonne holie ghost beginning euer shall world without end amen praise ye lord thanks giuen god first psalme morning praier lord heare word marke crieng king god vnto thee onelie come praie neither doo looke succour anie else thee lord beseech thee thou wilt gratiouslie hearken petition thy grace may spring hart morrowe light thy comfort night care perturbation ouerpassed suffer perish vngodlie folke whome thou cursest come running thee trusting mine owne righteousnes thy great manifold mercy lord rule thy iustice directed thy name sake make plaine thy waie waie thee least spirit malice doo turne thence let reioice repose themselues trust alwaies thy mercie let sing hymnes psalmes doo glorie reioice thee let triumph loue thy name defend lord thy grace shield time perill intent assaulted may yet constant cheere growe vp vnto full perfection glorie father c c second psalme oh lord god father beseech thee christ lord thine infinite mercie thou keepe time followe counsell vngodlie knowe thee hypocrite hart seeke thee lord suffer enter waie sinner mind fulfill desire lust flesh whensoeuer frailtie corrupt nature shall chance run astraie lord staie plucke foote backe againe keepe sit seate pestilent scorner cloaking pharisaicall diuellish intent condemne men thy veritie gospell oh lord bring passe may burne desire thy lawe vpon aduancement thy word mind may alwaies occupied may euermore choose pleasant thee hate selfe others thee displeasant make praie thee may tree planted sweet riuers thy ghostlie water intent may bring foorth fruit thy glorie profit neighbour often thou shalt minister time occasion therevnto least leaues word work fade fall awaie thing may prosper whatsoeuer shall doo thy name assist beseech thee grant mercifull father iesu christ sake may take roote ground life least vngodlie like chaffe dust blowne abrode pernicious wind world grant may stand assemblie righteous may enter iudgment without punishment escape euerlasting damnation glorie father c begin c third psalme thee lord lift vp mind thee trust lord god let confounded least mine enimies make iesting stocke matter laugh lord make thy way knowne vnto trade thy path direct thy truth instruct thou art god sauiour looke thee euerie daie lord thou art sweet rightfull bringest againe waie went thou leadest strait thy iudgement mild tractable teachest meeke thy word testimony thou healest contrite hart asswagest paine griefe thou holdest vp else fall fallen thou liftest vp againe thou giuest sight blind loosest bound thou art nigh vnto call vpon thee call vpon thee faithfullie thou fulfillest desire doo feare thee hearest praier sauest haue mercie vpon god haue mercie vpon thee soule trusteth uerelie soule hath speciall respect thee health glorie strength cometh thee thine owne sake oh lord god laie sin charge vnderstand mine errours innumerable trouble doo close round sinnes haue taken hold vpon able looke vp put thy hand helpe leade right work make walke perfectlie thy way kind sinne ouercome set watch mouth keepe doore lip let word mouth meditation hart euer pleasant acceptable thy sight let word truth neuer go awaie mouth suffer malice dwell hart lord deliuer soule lieng lip saue deceitfull tongue put mouth thy true holie word take idle vnfruitfull speech deliuer false surmise accusation men rule euen thou thinkest good thy pleasure turne awaie mine eies behold vaine thing fasten thy waie take fornication vncleannesse let loue flesh beguile yea deliuer soule pride doo reigne shall cleane greatest sinne staie keepe feete euerie euill waie least step swarue thy path mine eies looke euer vnto thee lord bicause thou art nigh hand thy way truth thy mercy great manie lord blessed whosoeuer trusteth thee said vnto thee feete slipped thy mercie lord hold vp teach doo thy leade thy pathwaie thou art god oh lord saue soule deliuer power darknesse let brightnesse thy face shine vpon thy seruant vnto thee lord god haue fled succor looke vnto haue mercie vpon desolate poore keepe soule deliuer confounded haue trusted thee lord god forsake although haue done good thy sight thy goodnesse grant leastwise may begin liue well lord shew thy seruants thy work child thy glorie gratious maiestie lord god vpon v oh prosper thou work hand oh prosper thou handie work glorie father person three dawning daie fast bind pilate conuented false witnesse iesus find cruell seniours iudgement presented beaten bodie defiled face yet god man verie well grace laud thee father c three houres past pilate throne people cried kill iesus iewes king crowne thornes purple made mone crosse ouer cedron bring prepared deadlie place galgatha hill suffer pain adam gilt father laud thee father c sirt houre approched painefull end tree bodie nailed heauen helpe earth freud died betweene two theeues elder railed thirsted elect subiect thrall unthankefullie offred vinegre mingled gall laud thee father c verie god god onlie begotten child said father hast thou forsaken yet receiue sacrifice spirit vndefild heauens darkned asunder stone shaken bloud water sprang blessed lamb graues opened dead aliue foorth came laud thee father thy grace c second meditation praier frailtie miserie miserable wretched woman may compared thy saint shall dwell thy tabernacle holie hill loue holie contemplation vaine multitude forgetting thee meeke vnpatient forget thee good lord remember thee affliction enforceth lamentable fall breethren constraine thanke thee thou mightie fearefull god host thy holie name blessed foreuer amen shall saie god thou art good euill thou holie miserable thou art light blind thou art blessed ioie carefull full sorowe lord thou art physician miserable patient nothing vanitie corrupt euerie liuing man shall saie creator thy creature shall perish thy hand haue made wounded thy bloud shed hath washed thy holie ghost hath sanctified taught yet lord day nothing mortall creature thus talke selfe lord god need hath lawe sorowe hath compelled seeke comfort sicknesse enforceth folowe physician conscience pricketh crie thee lord heauenlie cordiall comfort great discomfort borne woman full miserie shortnesse time passe awaie like shadowe neuer content one estate earth remaine euer hymne god creator creator thee thy creature call made mould liue paine sicke recourse great feare wonderfull agonie thou sauiour hadst mount oliuet thy bitter passion meditation thereof conceiue ghostlie comfort consolation profitable soule almightie god take vaineglorious mind appetite mine owne praise enuie couetise gluttonie sloth lecherie wrathfull affection appetite reuenging desire delight men harmes pleasure prouoking anie person wrath anger delight taunting deliuerest slauerie sathan purchasest mee free entrance thy celestiall region hauing singled amongst many millians knowe thee lie drowned ignorance superstition miserable errours thy seruant true faithfull christian thy blessed sacrament especiallie sacrament aboue sacrament wherein thou thy selfe art spirituallie conteined finallie hauing preserued manie time hell wherein beene long since mercie according thou hast giuen mee commandement call memorie time life euill dispent quake thinke vpon thee yea spirit faileth sore afraid thy iudgements yet well pondering processe thy grace mercie promised christ cease despaire knowing thou god hast forgotten thy gift grace thy power haue compassion waxen faint thou canst wilt put backe thy wrath iustlie conceiued sinne full trust whereof lord come vnto thee beseeching thee hide life christ within thee vnder shadowes thy wing defend thy grace couenant may euermore turne thy mercie lord bring downe destruction haue deserued shew thy grace fauour vnto may liue exalted thy righteousnesse praise thy name ioifullie remember corrupt nature lord short life thou madest man nothing man deliuer himselfe death man saue owne soule hell thou onelie lord must namelie beleeue thee life passeth doth dreame grasse field daie greene morrow drie thou displeased lost thou chafe shrinke feare sinnes dead vnto thee whome thousand yeares one daie yea least minute houre certesse lord thou haue respect sin shall continue shew therefore manie day life may dispend wiselie praise thy name least foolishlie trusting vpon long life suddenlie might perish come death come lord vnto v comfort v come god hide thy face like vnto hurled pit perdition night calamitie ouerpassed let pleasant morning comfort luckilie shine vpon betimes may heare feele thy goodnesse thee trust deliuer night snare sathans gard hunt darke plucke thee let stand feare nighteuill vnbeleefe thy strait iudgement neither let afraid fleeing arrowe daie time let feare horrible pestilence creeping darkenesse meane let ignorant detestable sin dissemble qualifie let dread middaie diuell abuseth thy church vnder title pretence holinesse neither let sathan though change himselfe angel light strike anie feare right side left well night daie well aduersitie prosperitie well spirituall businesse corporall let thy holie angel diligentlie wait vpon stumble shall tread vnderfoot hellie dragon yea shall dutie bound alwaie couragious spirit praise hallowe thy name onlie morrowe thing shall chance hart desire ascribe thy goodnesse without anie deseruing behalfe also night trouble aduersitie shall call vnto mind thy faithfull trustie promise despaire thus praise thy meere speciall grace blesse thee saieng blessed art thou lord god father thou art praise honour worthie magnified euer blessed glorie thy holie name worthie praised aboue magnified euer blessed art thou father sonne holie ghost thou art worthie praised aboue magnified euer blessed thou firmament world without end amen glorie father c begin c second psalme god god remember forsake suffer lost sith night daie crie thee heare lord father trusted thee thou helpedst whensoeuer called vpon thee tune thou failedst wast alwaies hand assist come foorth father deerelie beloued hart restore sathans kingdome thou drewest foorth mother wombe hast preserued vnto daie thy benignitie mercie beseech thee denie neede go awaie anguish pensiuenesse hart drawe nigh vnto yet none helpe thou onlie let escape danger thy christ sauiour sake hath suffered spitefull bitter paine sore vexed cruellie scourged wounded nailed hanged crosse let escape saie bloud sake largelie shed v cause v obteine forgiuenesse sinnes enioie new euerlasting couenant made betwixt thee v stand farre lord refuge strength come neere helpe deliuer life sword soule wood dog lion iawes restore betweene horne unicornes heare thou shall blowe abroade thy name praise vnto brother assemblie holie person shall commend thee despise praiers poore turne awaie thy face heare crie record thy goodnesse among miserable painefull troublesome conscience thereof may take hart comfort growe hope cleaue feruentlie vnto thee blowe abroade thy glorious name giue thee euerlasting thanks saluation amen glorie father c beginning c third psalme furthest angle earth euerie side thou shalt mightie voice call men iudgement lord god omnipotent whome nothing hid open eares may heare thy promise shall god thee constantlie beleeue thy foison filled prudentlie thou dost declare testifie good sacrifice thou hast need doest either regard measure thine thee lieth make thing possesse thou onlie requirest sacrifice thanke sgiuing let v therefore disclose bottome hart thee let v knowledge thee god let v halowe thy name thing flowe thy word render thanks weale wo require thy succour strait necessity time thou hast promised helpe v shall deliuered blase thy name lord god iust true promise deerest father thee beseech send succour vnto euen thine infinite goodnesse thy renowmes sake iesus christ sake thy beloued sonne pretious bloud largelie shed v crosse haue mercie vpon purged may come againe fauour thee pitie heare strait sinfull flesh wherewith euerie side hampered set large againe rid mine enimies seeke drawe awaie thy true seruice thy comfort let reioice full spirituall ioie let euer brute thy name vnmindfull thy benefit releeue pitifull god according thy word truth tender father shew thy ioifull health glorie father c begin c fourth psalme thy clemencie blessing mightie god craue require thee full instantlie let thy countenance shine vpon v haue compassion vpon v earth wee may find waie leadeth vnto thee may attaine thy saluation among gentils people would confesse thee louing hart thy manifold benefit pleasure haue receiued thy hand dost iustice gouerne men art leader vpon earth powre downe lord thy goodnesse continuall blessing vpon v shall earth yeeld vnto thee glorie praise v fruit meate thou god father blesse v thou god sonne blesse v thou god holie ghost blesse v yea thou holie blessed glorious trinitie grant v thy continuall blessing coast earth lord god would feare stand awe thee would paine anguish finallie dreadfull death ala shall hereafter stinking carion woormes meate foode fire dust claie doong forsaken rotten consumed blind poore naked troden vnder feete posteritie forgotten men knowing bodie shall vanish like shadowe life shall wither like leafe fade flower holie god body doo increase neerer death doth approch clocke conscience doth ring euerie minute houre death hand death approcheth sharpe dart bloudie chariot awaie saith euerie liuing wight shall see death come nothing oh vncertaine life assured death net cast ouer flesh doo reioice lament whole sicknesse doth come haue friend forsaken libertie soone bondage yoong age drawes neere thus neuer remaine one state made light proud prosperitie desperate aduersitie withered old care despised pouertie flattered health finally vncertaine shall die yet humblie praie thee deere father iesu christ sake suffered shamefull death sin haue mercie vpon according thy great mercie take thy holie ghost lead temptation deliuer thy hand commend soule thou god truth amen hymne state adam posteritie fruit adam hand sin lockt satan band destined deth child ire flaming brand infernall fire borne naked bare spend time sorowe care shall returne vnto dust depriued carnall lust yet thou father didst iesus send pardon offend laud work might blessed sight second meditation dreadfull daie iudgement feare sorowe shall happen reprobate shall stand helpelesse terrible dreadfull throne god render account thought word work saie act flesh bloud extreame day shall come fire creature heauen earth hell shall tremble presence shall guiltie conscience opened euils endlesse punished iudge corrupted daie doth come daie hand pure hart shall accepted bribe vaine gift shall preferred iustice without mercie vnto vngodlie infernall torment wicked endlesse care affliction idolater fornicator extortioner persecutour disobedient murtherer blasphemer theefe false witnesse bearer vsurer heretikes witch malefactor vessel diuels monster infernall second death bodie soule shall remaine paine long god euerlasting daie hand elect saint patriarch prophet martyr blessed shall receiue reward themselues onlie iesu blessed euerlastinglie glorified father sonne holie ghost three person one god mercie defend v damnation vnspeakeable paine wee sinne haue deserued euer punished withall yet iesus preserued whome elected redeemed iustified brought sinne death hell laud praise world world angel men amen hymne daie iudgement sweet iesus thy mercie pitifull praiers heare may thy right hand thou shalt appeare thou shalt come heauenlie power sit throne none shall iudge quicke dead thou christ alone christ cast v awaie daie ire thou shalt send thee hot consuming fire purge creature defild adam sinne new heauen earth lord thou wilt beginne elect shall blessed vpon thy holie hill wicked shall damned haue withstood thy thy sheepe shall safe defended fold goat shall wander hunger storme cold thy saint shall behold thee thy throne light reprobate shall euer haue fearefull thing sight wailing wretchednesse euerlasting paine yet lord mercifull liues vaine flesh shall fade death hath digd graue yet thy mercie lord thy sinfull creature saue blesse v time grace daie ire corrupt element shall purgd fire laud thee father c generall praier wherein commend selues whole state christ church vnto god god thou father god life suffer neither haue proud looke proud thought turne awaie voluptuousnesse let intisements world beguile let concupiscence eie deceiue let lust flesh take hold vpon let rancor malice reigne hart lord god thy sonne sauiour iesu christ sake beseech thee thou wilt giue ouer vnshamefast obstinate mind unto thee lord almightie king mercie bee euer eternall honour glorie unto thee lord mercie doo commit soule bodie humblie beseeching thee thine abundant mercie sake take cure haue mercie doo commit also vnto thy mercie faithfull friend wellwillers liuing beseeching thee forgiue v haue mercie vpon v giue v grace liue according thy lawe glorie thy name may doo thou requirest v please thee thy mercie saue defend v peril bodilie ghostlie night euer especiallie thing shall turne thy displeasure hart thanke thee mercifull lord great benefit thou hast bestowed vpon largelie world afore manie creature woorthie thousand time gratious lord wot knowledge verelie good gift doo come freelie thee thine abundant mercie wherefore hart thanke thee worship praise thanks thee none therefore saie prophet dauid vnto v lord vnto v vnto thy name giuen honour glorie also commit thy mercie mine enimies persecutor slanderer beseeching thee turne hart giue v grace one forgiue another verie botome hart hencefoorth may liue loue charitie thy glorie increase thy kingdome doo commit thy mercie queene elizabeth realme beseeching thee incline hir hart godlinesse vertue may long reigne ouer v peace tranquillitie liue thy feare call vpon thy holie name readie time set foorth thy blessed lawes commandements thou omnipotent god thy mightie hand stretched arme wilt confound idolatrie superstition set vp thy true holie religion thy faithfull seruants may triumph reioice thee merie hart sing vnto thy praise mightie hand god hath brought passe thy name giue honour glorie whome honour glorie due doo commit vnto thy mercie transitorie life sorowe sicknesse neede tribulation anie aduersitie speciallie profession thy gospell defence saine doo put liues vnto edge sword lord thy mercy sake forgiue v offence past comfort greeuous affliction strengthen weakenesse send patience tribulation abate pride enimies asswage malice confound wicked deuises armed thy mightie defence may preserued euermore peril glorifie thee art onlie giuer victorie ye merit christ commit thy mercie doo faithfullie professe thy holie gospell beseeching thee giue v grace liue according thy lawes well dooing may stop mouthes vngodlie aduersaries gospell thereby win right waie may one hart one mouth glorifie thee lord god daie visitation whome honour glorie due mercifull lord louing father finallie commit vnto thy mercie wretched soule bodie humblie beseeching thee haue mercie vpon according thy great bountifull mercie according multitude thy tender compassion doo awaie beseech thee greeuous iniquity unto god father sonne holie ghost euer eternall honour glorie world without end amen praier night going bed god angel men founder creature visible inuisible whose hand life death light darknesse motion soule bodie without whome good gift perfect quietnesse conscience onlie vanitie vexation mind vtter confusion soule bodie finall torment horrible pit darknesse lord god darknesse doth approch daie hath lost beautie vnworthie thy benefit humblie praie thee night blesse thy holie angel assist thy holie spirit night lighten hast earth made thy creature doest nourish thy bloud hast consecrated thee dwell eternallie glorie death hath dissolued vanitie c banish sathan neither mine owne conscience vexe mine old offence trouble humblie beseech thee night pardon haue sore offended thee thought word deede thy diuine maiestie sore repenteth saue good lord night sleeping dreadfull dreames handmaiden great burden sinne iniquitie meanes corruption filthinesse acknowledge selfe child death destruction yet build still thy promise good lord great danger come vnto thee teares saieng father thy commandement thereby deserued eternall death damnation yet thou like louing pitifull father diddest vtterlie reiect gentlie correct thou hadst sent earth commanding increase multiplie thou didst thine exceeding great mercie kindnesse without anie desert mankind much anie one praier yet intreatie therevnto incited therefore boldened inestimable benefit freelie giuen bestowed doo without feare commandest make onelie hearer thy heauenlie doctrine also perfect folower direct sanctifie gouerne life thou alwaies present readie heare helpe saue defend shame reproch thou shield buckler temptation
